column3: ["Male35 y.o  6'4, & 170 lbs, thin muscular build. ordered 6 pk gilad, white shirts for $18 ish and it fits perfect good material would recommend. He says he wished the arm length were a little longer.( But i think it looks good ) Also, i have not washed them yet so idk how much they will shrink or not. If when i do wash and dry they shrink alot, then i will update this review. If i dont update this review then they did not shrink to much. Length is perfect a little below belt , fit at chest and waist is perfect. But with that being said he is very tall and sometimes need to buy from big and tall section. But i dont think this falls in that category. I think anyone 5'9 or taller length would fit really good. My 17 y.o son is 5'9 and 140 lbs and still has growing to do as he is more on the skinny side, needs a size small. Would recommend and would buy again. Very satisfied with this purchase", 'I purchased the XL pack.The title says it all, but to be helpful for people of different sizes:I am about 6\'2" tall, 210 lbs.I have a set of Large Gildan undershirts, and they are passable, but too small. My problem with undershirts is that XL ones are almost always way too big, and the L ones aren\'t long enough.These ones are almost perfect. I would like an inch or a little less of extra length, but most of the time, I expect these to stay tucked in. They are also pretty soft, and seem to be made of a little thicker material than my other undershirts (Hanes and the older L Gildan ones that I mentioned).', 'I had low expectations as cause every t shirt seems to just suck but this one fit exactly as I hoped it would. That being said I washed them then dried them on low heat ( I do this with all cheap t shirts anyway as they seem to always have a weird long fit out of the box ) They are high up the arm and fit tightly around the chest an waist but not to tight to where they are uncomfortable. For reference I‚Äôm lean but with slightly broader shoulders and I‚Äôd say ‚Äúathletic arms‚ÄùI‚Äôll update this review in a month or so if the shirts randomly become unwearable which happens to be the theme with cheap clothing but as of right now these are going to be my go to ‚Äú plain shirts ‚Äú if nothing changes. Hope this helped']

["My son loves this jacket and wears it everywhere!  It's sized just right.  Beautiful fabric and high end plush lining that washes well and stays soft after washing.  My son is 6' 5' and 210 pounds.  The Large Tall fits great, but the X-Large is good too if you like an extra roomy fit.  It is warmer than a sweat shirt, but not too warm.", 'The jacket shrinks a full size after a heavy duty wash and dry cycle.  I factored that in when sizing, so now I have a great fitting XL from my XXL purchase.  I love how the pockets are low in the jacket - they make comfortable hand warmers.  The jacket is also longer than my previous shirt/jackets - it fits more like a parka.Snaps are a DIY affair since the factory installed snaps quickly fall off.  You need to purchase a $15 snap repair kit and redo those.  Minus one point for that.', 'Gave this to our son. He loved it and decided it would be great to go to wine tasteing in the Va. hills. Loved that. I thought the quality was great.']

['The tshirt is comfortable and extremely soft, but is it worth the money.. no . Is it any different than a normal tshirt, not really.', 'I got the 3xl six pack and DAMN! Trims your love handles, covers your arms right and fits nice around the chest. These are surprisingly comfortable. Worth the buy', 'Fit great right out of the package.  So far so good. Being that they are so soft I am wondering how long they will hold up. I would recommend at this point.']

['These are great in the field, and when hunting, but look classy enough to wear on a date or to go clubing. Warm and very comfortable feel. And something a manly-man would wear, but they\'re soft to the touch, and the ladies seem to like and appreciate the soft texture, as you\'ll find them stroking your arms allot, with their fingers.  And that\'s nice too!  And you can tell yourself, it ain\'t the "shirt", it\'s these manly "Guns" of mine, she loves to stroke!  Oh yeah!', "As a weight lifter, it's difficult for me to find shirts that fit properly. I went with the XL Tall after reading some reviews.Pros:The shirt fits my arms and shoulders like a dream, not constricting my movement while not being too baggy either. The front pocket sits in the correct spot on my chest. The fabric is comfortable and visually appealing.Cons:The XL Tall fits my arms and chest but a bunch of problems appear once you get down to my waist. It's too baggy, and it's too long. To the point I only wear it at home.Synopsis:It's a great comfortable shirt. Just be prepared to spend a little extra for a tailor to fit the waist and hem it up if you're top heavy.", 'I really like these flannels. I wear between a medium and a large, and the large size fits me well while other brands always seem tight in the shoulders. The only problem is the solid colors seem to be made of a different material than the plaid ones. Even though they both say "100% Cotton" and are both made in Cambodia, the solid color ones seem to be made of something closer to felt, and they shrink in the wash! This is especially noticeable in the length of the sleeves; the arms on mine are now about 2 inches shorter than those of the plaid ones I own. If you steer clear of the solid colored ones, these are 5/5 for me. It\'s unfortunate, though, because I really did want a well fitting solid green flannel.']

['For us that love these types of outer wear, long sleeved, color zipper neck. And it does keep you warm.Anything less than 35 degrees would be too much for this to handle.  Love the colors.', "This shirt is very warm and comfortable but not to heavy. I'm very pleased with the quality and I am sure it will last a long time.", "Its a nice pullover for the price but it runs big and is sized more like outer wear through the body. I wear a size (L) and I would have returned it for a (M) but I'm afraid it would be too small in the chest and shoulders"]

["Pros:A slightly better grade of cotton, soft but not sumptuous.A slightly thicker grade of cotton by modern standards. Thinner than old world standards.Fits well throughout the body.Very nice shoulder double seams.Tagless constructionCons:They could be longer. There isn't even a quarter of an inch of extra material here.After the first wash (cold/cold) the waistband no longer lays flat.Waited 3 weeks for them to ship?Summary:With regard to current underwear construction methods, these are a little nicer than your average Walmart brands, but they are not that special.", "I don't write many reviews...Excellent shirts. Great quality, stitching. Good feel and thickness. They look and feel great.I purchased these because I was desperate for something to wear at nights as I suffer from night sweats. The product information claims the material is good at keeping moisture from the body.Tried them for the first time last night. Wow!  Simply Wow!  This shirt does everything it promises as far as keeping the wetness off of your body. Would work great for anyone with night sweats, or someone who sweats a lot, loves our 100% cotton, but not the soaked material clinging to you. This is your shirt.I bought 3 - 6 packs to start, great decision... ordering a few more because they're so awesome.Good job Gildan!  üëçüëçüêæ", "These are very soft and comfortable. They fit mostly as expected, but I would always order one size larger if expected shrinkage is likely to be an issue. They do wrinkle quite easily, even fresh out of the dryer, so it's good to spray some dewrinkle fabric spray on them before wearing them and to hang them up rather than folding them. It's very manageable for casual wear."]

["These shirts are a great deal for a four pack. I only wished there was a way where you could pick four different colors instead of the same color for all four shirts. Please keep in mind, these shirts are 100% cotton and they do shrink a little. So if you're in-between sizes, I would suggest to size up a little. I bought a size which I knew would be slightly larger for me and after I washed and dried the shirts, they were perfect size because they shrunk about 1.5 inches from the sides and from the bottom.  But this is a great buy, and the shirt is not too thick and it's not too thin, but just right!", 'As long as you‚Äôre not a delicate little flower.  Then these are fine shirts. Good thick fabric, 100% cotton (but low thread count feel), will shrink, NOT tagless but tag rips off easily.For this price point, there is no point in complaining as if you paid more so here are some things to expect:It‚Äôs 100% cotton so it‚Äôs going to shrink since it‚Äôs not ‚Äúpre-shrunk‚ÄùIt‚Äôs possible these are ‚Äúfake‚Äù as many claim, or it may be Hanes cutting back on quality control. There is no way to knowing one way or another but here are some observations.Got 3 packs and 1 shirt had a hole in the back already.Shirts will NOT arrive in Factory branded bags, they‚Äôll be in generic sealed plastic bags (my guess is because its easier for ‚Äútry before you buy returns‚Äù to be folded/packaged/resealed for the next buyer) so wash before wearing.This is NOT tagless, but the tag does tear off easily. This doesn‚Äôt PROVE these are fake of knock offs (Maybe Hanes has a large stockpile of tags they can sew on for the cost of nothing instead of spending on the special ink, running the machinery and employees trained to operate said machinery to get that tagless. Idk.These are most likely 100% cotton as claimed so they WILL shrink! I find the larger the shirt size the more they will shrink relative to their size. So plan accordingly.A common complaint is that they‚Äôre itchy. All I can say is WASH BEFORE WEARING as you should be anyways. Ever heard of demodex mites? Now you have.Another complaint is that they feel rough. this isn‚Äôt 3000 thread count Egyptian cotton feeling more like 300 thread count. With that said these are FAR thicker than the genuine Hanes shirts I‚Äôve bought in store in the last few years. Personally, I‚Äôve never noticed.Bottom line: If you are the type of guy who may not even own a pair of cargo pants (anymore) but loved them because of its functionality. Who knows what SAE/metric is, and doesn‚Äôt wear tight jeans (by choice).Chances are very high you‚Äôll be happy with these.$2.50/shirt + tax', "I'm top heavy which makes it hard to find tshirts that fit how I want them to. I wear baggy clothes, I have since my teen years and I'm sure I always will. Basic tshirts in multi pack that fit are rare for me to find. These run a little large, which I am happy with, however I could easily go down to a 3x. You can take the tag off clean but you won't know which side is which. It's a good purchase."]

['I normally by two sizes bigger than I need and that makes them big width wise but just long enough. These I bought one size larger than I would buy a normal t shirt and with these being longer than normal, that worked well but I don‚Äôt think they would have been long enough if I hadn‚Äôt bought one size larger.  I‚Äôm very happy with them.', "If you don't like your undershirt coming untucked then this is the perfect t-shirt of you.  This is the 2nd time I've purchased them and pleased once again.  These first set I bought has lasted over 5 years easily and that is basically wearing them every single week!!!  Very little shrinkage over time!!!  I will buy again!!!!", "For those who like and undershirt these fit the bill. Sizes are correct. Feel is good. Doesn't shrink when washing and drying.. Material is strong and stitching is good. Looks to last a long time. Good value for your money."]

["My husband wanted a purple and black check flannel shirt. I have found those colors hard to come by in a flannel, especially in a men's tall size. The material is very soft and a thin to medium weight.  Nice for a casual gathering, running errands, or even on vacation! The purple color in this shirt is not dull but not bright, it's very appealing!  The body of the shirt is not tapered but it's not baggy. The sleeves are nice and long just as they should be in a tall size. It washes/dries great on warm cycles, with no shrinking, minimal wrinkles and irons easy.  Would definitely buy again. Best of all, my husband loves this shirt! :-)", "I ordered 4 of these thinking I was getting 10 oz  100% cotton flannel. I live in flannel for about 7-8 months of the year.  I have all weights‚Äî some light weight,  some medium and some true heavy weight. These are not 10 oz-- which is usually considered a heavier weight. I doubt they're even 8 oz...they're very thin. They may be only 6 oz. or ..maybe,  a blend?  I didn't try them on. I didn't even take the two which arrived yesterday out of the zippered plastic bags they were shipped in. When I picked them up I knew the weight was too light. I opened them and felt the fabric --- that's all it took. I suppose I could have been shipped the wrong ones.  When you make the same shirt --except, maybe for the  2 chest  pockets--in the same fabric design and colors in 3 different weight fabrics... it would be easy to do.  Easy to mix them up‚Äî if I give everyone the benefit of doubt, that is.Well,  I  just  did my due diligence. I took one completely out of the bag and looked at the labels.They don't even say what the fabric is made of--WHICH IS ILLEGAL, I BELIEVE, IN THIS COUNTRY.  For all we know they‚Äôre not even 100% cotton and could cause an allergic reaction for those of us allergic to synthetics.Unbelievable!Are we suppose to be so impressed because they say they're ‚Äúdesigned in Italy‚Äù  that we look no further.It says that everywhere.  But.. who the h‚Ä¶ cares where it was designed?It's a basic flannel shirt. Nothing special!  The pattern isn‚Äôt matched at the seams, pockets, the frontplacket nor the cuffs & sleeve plackets. The sleeves have a 2-button cuff and a long placket going up the sleeve, about 5-6 in, with only 1 button closing it.  There is no pleat on the center back. The buttons are not color matched‚Äî  they‚Äôre a grayish white plastic that stands out like a sore thumb.  Maybe that‚Äôs suppose to be a ‚Äúdesign feature‚Äù‚Ä¶kind of like those dresses that appeared, and disappeared, rather quickly, that had a very obvious zipper going up the center back. I hated them‚Äîthought they looked cheap & unfinished.  After all, they didn‚Äôt have to make a proper placket, saving on both fabric and labor.This shirt was made in China.I‚Äôm not the first person to complain about the 10 oz being too light weight to be real. That should have been addressed  by Amazon &  Alimens and Gentle.  Some one should have made sure they were clearly marked as to the fabric weight and which shirt is which.  But no where does it say what the weight of the fabric is on either of the labels ‚Äîon top of leaving out it‚Äôs composition..I just realized, it doesn‚Äôt even identify the brand on the shirt. There is no brand identification at the inside neck, here it usually is, neither on a label nor printed onto the fabric as a label-less article of clothing. There is only a small label that says  ‚ÄúDesigned in Italy‚Äù, once more!Hold on‚Äî I wanted to double check the other- the laundry label.  It doesn‚Äôt  id the brand either.  For all we know these are just  cheap knock-0ffs, or, maybe, ‚ÄúDesigned in Italy‚Äù is the brand not Alimens & Gentle.  ?  The only place the brand is id‚Äôd is on the sticker label on the outside of the plastic zippered bag.  No fabric info and no brand labels on the shirt  itself‚Äîanywhere.I only bought these because I wanted the heavier weight and I thought Alimens & Gentle were a reputablecompany who made fairly good quality clothing.After the other two arrive,  which should be later today, I‚Äôll do a return for all 4. One was suppose to be a gift, but he too needs heavy weight ‚Äînot another mid to light weight flannel shirt of unknown fabric content.I‚Äôm surprised and disappointed in this brand. I won‚Äôt be buying it again.Amazon if you‚Äôre listening‚Ä¶. you need to do something about this. It‚Äôs illegal and although supposedlymanufactured for & sold by Alimens & Gentle,  there‚Äôs nothing on the garment itself that supports this.Also Atten  Amazon Essentials:  both men & women need some truly heavy weight 100% cotton flannel shirts for the winter.  It‚Äôs too late for this yr, but you could get some in the works for next winter.Women, too, get cold in cold weather and we  prefer to wear shirts made for us, rather than men‚Äôs shirts.Unfortunately, all the women‚Äôs shirts are light weight flannel, mostly blends. Guess they think we don‚Äôtget cold!  Reminds me of no pockets in women‚Äôs pants‚Äîuntil we complained enough and they finallylistened.I would not recommend these shirts to anyone unless you truly don‚Äôt care what the fabric is made ofnor who made it.  Me‚Ä¶ I believe where there‚Äôs smoke, there‚Äôs fire,  and I‚Äôve learned not to be so trusting. But, then,  speaking of smoke & fire‚Ä¶.I didn‚Äôt vote for DJT either.  Who knows, maybe, he imported these unidentified shirts!  There is truth to ‚Äúa tiger doesn‚Äôt change its‚Äô stripes‚Äù.", 'This shirt is perfect for my husband I had to buy another one in a different color he likes it so much. He‚Äôs 6‚Äù3 and where‚Äôs a size 4x. He typically wears a size 3x when it comes to a regular shirt that has a bit of a stretch but a 4x fit him perfectly. He said it‚Äôs not thin, but it‚Äôs not to thick either. He likes to wear tank tops on under his shirt. It is perfect for him and compliments him very well!']
['good shirts for the price!', 'Excelente', 'great item , fast shipping,  classy fit , true white']

["I purchased this shirt for my son for their weekly chapel days at school when they have to wear a tie. This shirt was purchased 1) because I do not have time (or want) to iron it and 2) I do not want to have it dry cleaned weekly. So after 3 months of use, I can definitely say this shirt is not wrinkle free.  I have to iron it with every washing. Not really bad wrinkles, but it still needs ironing even with steaming it in the dryer.  Just a little nugget for those wanting it because it's wrinkle free. Very pleased with it otherwise.  I purchased Large, and it's a good, normal fit, and it looks good (after ironing).", "It's very good when you want to look formal and at the same time it feels comfortable like a polo shirt etc.", 'It looks really good on my husband he looks slender and thinner and h said very comfortable to wear']

['So I was trying to find something like an old Footlocker plain white t that were perfect with thickness even after washing and just the right size. I cant stand when shirt sleeves start rising up. These are slightly thinner than the FL Tshirts however they come close. I did a wash to be sure and they still stand up as a non undershirt to wear out.  Sleeves didnt rise and the XL fit nicely (IM 6,1 & 195).  I personally dont like shirts extremely soft. If rather have that durability feel and these are probally the best thing to what im looking for. If youre looking for the FL Plain tshirt feel like I was get these.', "I've been wearing Gildan undershirts for almost 20 years, these are probably the best version I've ever purchased. Why...?1) Not tagless, but tags removed easily w/simple tear2) Heavier duty, but NOT too heavy [I sweat so I need ones that soak it up preventing it from showing to top layer + not as thick as the HEAVY version which can be too much]. The thickness also provides a better form fit under your top layers [not sticking to those unflattering curves for us non-super models] and helps to create a sold shapely base for the top layers.3] Still TBA but so far I believe these will hold up longer than versions advertised as undershirts which are so thin the stain easy, wrinkle, and provide no shape. The thinner version sinks into cracks and crevasses typically taking the top layers with it creating an unflattering look.4] Sleeves stay in place [as undershirt, as opposed to the thinner ones that constantly roll up under your top layers, ultimately [at least for me] requiring constant readjustment.5] Looking forward to confirming but I've been finding the thinner version advertised as undershirts typically require replacement [bleach won't return them to white once pit stains wear in which eventually start show through when wearing thinner or light colored top layers], the overall feel and quality of this version have me anticipating a much longer shelf life [and I'm one who wears them daily under all wardrobe combinations.6] They're GILDAN, and as brand loyal customer, I can say hands down I've never find a more reasonably priced brand that delivers quality like Gildan does!!! While staying affordable [Walmart used to carry them but those idiots no longer do so Amazon typically offers the best pricing.I've only had this batch about a week now, should they not meet expectations, I will return to update this feedback with explanations and findings.Hope my review helps you determine if this version is right for you!!!", 'I‚Äôm a small female so I ordered an XS, I washed them soon as I got them as I do any clothing. Shirts are thin but very comfortable and fit perfectly.']

["I like this long sleeve T-Shirt. Good fit around shoulders, and across chest, I am normally a medium but found them to be too snug around belly, so I returned them and sized up for the extra material below chest area, (because.... Yeah.) Still fit very well.  My problem is with the cuffs, I mean if you sport this type of shirt, you're going to pull up the sleeves, but they fail in keeping shape, they stretch around the forearm and it's done. They don't return back to fit around the wrist evere again like they did before. So it's a fail in that area, I mean, even when it wear a dress shirt untucked, and with jeans, you naturally fold up the sleeves for that casual look, not to be able to pull the sleeves up on a shirt like this (and not ruin cuffs) is pitiful. Gildan should use a better knit around cuffs", 'Makes for a nice, loose fitting shirt for fall and winter use. The fabric feels very durable and it was a great deal on the pair. I bought them because they were inexpensive and I was going to make a Die Hard  "Now I Have A Machine G*n. Ho Ho Ho" (if you know, you know) Christmas shirt out of one with a red magic marker for a party because it was cheaper than buying one, but when I got them, I didn\'t want to ruin one because they were really nice for the price.', 'I bought several packs of two in different colors last year, and one other color just recently. I wear them more days than not from September on into the spring. On days it is comfortable enough indoors and out, I weat them over a tee-shirt. I am retired and don\'t have to wear a suit and tie daily as I used to. I don\'t even need to wear a collared sport shirt and dress slacks. Most months I wear them with shorts; on winter days I team them up with one of several fleeced jackets in differen colors I have(Amazon Brand, reviewed elsewhere). Then I swap the shorts for full-length stretch knits.I am 5\' 11" tall and weigh 170 lbs. The large fits perfectly,sleeve length and all. Pretty much form-fitting but loose enough to be comfortable (if you don\'t have a gut and aren\'t muscle-bound.']

["I bought 3 of these shirts. 2 for my teenage boys and 1 as a gift for my step-father.True to size. My youngest is  6'3 140lbs a medium fit him perfectly. My oldest is 6 foot 185lbs and a large fit him perfectly. I will say the large was a tad bulkier in the arms on my oldest.My stepfather was in a size medium. 5'9 roughly 150lbs. And it fit perfectly.Excellent quality.  Thicker flannel.  I would most definitely order more.", "I feel like many of the shirts are too short for me, so you have to understand my build. My chest is deceptively broad and as a result, almost everything feels short. This is no different. It is rare for me to find a shirt that I don't think is too short - so this actually probably fits exactly as it should. It is a comfy shirt (although it took a few washes to get the stiffness out of it). It has a little bit of static to it - but not bad compared to other flannels. It is thicker (and warmer) than I expected. If they had other styles I liked I would absolutely purchase more of them. All and all a good purchase...when you take the cost into account it was an excellent purchase.", "I have been mostly satisfied with the shirt. The shirt fits well and is made of a soft and comfortable fabric. It is also well-constructed, with good attention to detail and durable stitching.One issue I had with the shirt is that the pattern was not exactly as I expected based on the online photos. It wasn't a major issue, but the colors and pattern were slightly different in person than what I had expected. This is something to keep in mind if you are considering purchasing this shirt. Maybe I just didn't like how it looks on me..Overall, I would recommend. It is a well-made and comfortable shirt that is a great value for the price."]

['This is my kids whole style- with and without sweaters or vests over top.  I‚Äôm so impressed with the Amazon brand!!  I can‚Äôt stand artificial fabrics, and these are real, old school, tough, thick cotton.They‚Äôve stood up to 6 months of continuous wear and abuse wonderfully, though we got a few extras just in case.', 'Wished it was a tad longer and a more of solid print', 'This shirt is just exactly what we hoped it would be. It fits perfectly, is made with good, sturdy material, and is a perfect color. We will probably order another one just like it.']

['This were purchased as a Christmas gift for my brother who is Intellectually & Developmentally Disabled as well as in a nursing home. Shirt was a perfect fit. The color was nice as he has blue eyes & it brings them out even more.', 'This was for my husband at Christmas but I decided to go with a different brand.', "This shirt is nice. It's a typical long sleeve t-shirt. It fits nice and is well made. Got it for my son to wear under his long sleeve flannels on the really nasty cold days. He loves it."]

["This lined flannel shirt was a gift for my daughter's boyfriend, and he loved it. It looked like it might have been too big, but when he tried it on, I was pleased to see the fit. It will be a great additional layer to a hoodie or long sleeve shirt, worn either as a jacket or an inside layer as well. I love this type of clothing item because it serves many purposes. The color, too, looked great- it's nice to see a light tone with touches of darker colors rather than the other way around. This was a win and the cost and quality were a perfect match.", 'It runs big. My hubby usually wear an XL, he\'s 6\'1" at 190 and the sleeves on this must have been made for someone 7 feet tall. I\'ll move the button over and it should be ok. It is nice and soft with the lightweight sherpa lining. I was expecting it to be heavier so he could wear out in the shop without a vest but not the case but it will be great in the spring. He says it\'s comfy except for the sleeves but once they\'re fixed it will be fine. I think I should have ordered a size large not XL.', 'Got this for my dad for Christmas and he loves it!Great warmth with the fleece lining in the body.But also perfect is that they quilted - not fleece lined - the sleeves.That makes this much easier to wear over long sleeved tees as it doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúgrab‚Äù sleeve material as you put it on OR while you wear it!I put my 77 yr old Dad‚Äôs measurements here and I got him the 2xSize offers plenty of room and allowance for a bit of shrink with washing too.']

['These are the best T-shirts I have ever purchased! Better than any of the name brands and I wear T -shirts a lot because of my work. You are crazy if you don‚Äôt listen and buy these! Lol', "Perhaps my bad, but other than the picture, I could not determine how many tee shirts were included in an order.  so I ordered three packs and got nine shirts, very soft, and comfortable especially in warm weather because ethyl feel so light. At today's prices, they are a bargain", 'Vibrant colors did not fade after multiple washings. Fabric is soft and comfortable.']

["Nice shirt, not too heavy, comfortable. I bought a large and it fits well, but usually I'm between medium and large, so if in doubt about fit, go up in size rather than down.One issue: the left sleeve cuff was not sewn all the way, it looks like the picture I uploaded on first time wearing the shirt. Not the quality control I expected from Hanes.", "Overall good. I bought as a layering item for winter work on farms. I'm a woman with long arms and broad shoulders so I often buy men's shirts for work. That means the body of the shirt is often too big, but not so for this shirt. It has what I would consider a trim fit. Keep that in mind if you prefer a relaxed, looser fit.", "Nice long sleeved pull over shirt.  They are not made with the same material as a regular T shirt so the stretch isn't as much.  However, does fit well and works really good for a night shirt or an under shirt for when your wearing a flannel for those chilly days where a jacket is to much.As far as sizing goes, much of it has to do with personal preference.  I for one do not like clothing that is closely coupled to size.  In other words I do not like clothes that are a snug fit.  Keeping that in mind, I may suggest that you look through your closet and see which brands you already own and the sizing of those items and order based on that.Would recommend"]

['I purchased the Gildan men\'s Ultra cotton t-shirts awhile back, and I thought it would be a good time to write my review. My Gildan men\'s t-shirts were ordered in navy blue, and they arrived as the expected color and size. I ordered them for my son who needs shirts that are longer due to his height. He is 6\' 3", and these t-shirts were the perfect length.The shirts fit as expected and quite comfortable. He wore them as a traditional t-shirt and an undershirt. They were slightly bigger than regular undershirts. I\'d recommend a snugger fit if you plan to use them as a undershirt. After washing them the first time, they did shrink slightly. The t-shirts did not shrink enough to lose the length he needed. They did not fade that much after multiple washes and remained in good condition after several months of wear. We have purchased additional colors (red, black, gray, and a lighter blue), and we are happy with our purchases.', 'Probably my favorite shirt brand. Sizes are accurate. I am 6‚Äô1 210 lbs, and I get medium. It fits slightly tight and hugging the body as I prefer it to. I just wish it was slightly longer. Doesn‚Äôt shrink easily either. Great product.', "I got this shirt for my husband's shaggy Halloween costume. They were the perfect color. The only complaint I have is they are a bit rough in texture, very starchy. I was hoping they would be softer, but it still did the job!"]

['I bought this shirt for my husband to wear in our family photos, the quality is great, it is made of a medium flanel weight, the brown lining looks nice and gives that extra spark of style and the colors are a rich green, that accented our neutral color scheme we were going for. Overall a shirt he can wear again and again. He typlically wears a Medium in Mens and this one fit true to size.', 'Great over shirt to boost your internal temperature when surroundings are chilly.  I never realized how warn fleece was, but now I do.  I wear this as an "overshirt" at home.  The fit is as specified and the red color is very Christmassy. I have a long torso though, so I'm sure the regular will work for others just fine.", 'The suede collar and cuffs never get old. So comfortable.  Just a quality shirt.  The only slightly odd thing is the neck is a little big, even after washing, but not a deal-breaker.  Finding the right size is tricky. I am 6\'1"and 180 lbs. and I think my ideal size is Large Tall.  I bought XL and it fits okay after washing, but the LT is better for my build. They do shrink a little after washing.  I washed in cold then low heat dryer. I bought 3 of these shirts. It\'s nice that they have the options for large, tall but the trick is figuring out what will be right for you after you\'ve washed the shirt.Update: 12/17/22  I just ordered another XL of these shirts. I wish they would get in the Denim Blue Melange and the Oatmeal Melange.  I compared the new unwashed XL to 3 washed and dried on warm many times after a year XL\'s and 1 Large Tall LT.  See photos.The sleeves shrink just under 3 inches. The LT is longer in body but not in sleeves. The XL\'s are roomy around chest and waist. I like that, I think most guys nowadays would want it to be snugger. I prefer the room, but the shirt does look big on me. I don\'t care, it feels great. I wear it over a T-shirt and depending on the weather, button it or leave it unbuttoned, it looks and feels great.You have to wash these and dry them to see what their real size is going to wind up being.  At around $40 a shirt, it\'s an expensive experiment. It wouldn\'t even matter if you could find these in a store and try them on in person because the size changes so much after you wash them.  I think the neck opening is still big no matter what.  It\'s strange in spite of all these size issues, this is still such a quality shirt.  They are so comfortable. I just wish they had the colors I wanted.  Of course that ugly green one is always available. Sorry to the guys who bought the ugly,... I mean the stylish green one.Originally I said the LT was my ideal size and I think if someone else were looking at me wearing it, it would look better but the XL feels more comfy.  And I usually reach for the XL\'s.The XL\'s shrink by almost 3 inches in the sleeves and only by about 2 inches in the chest after being washed and dried on warm. These have a free returns policy so you could buy a few different sizes and imagine them a few inches shorter in the sleeves and in the torso. Long sizes are about two inches longer only in the torso.  I didn\'t notice much difference in the sleeves but then again I compared XL to LT, not XLT.  I knew that once I washed them I couldn\'t return them.  If you wash two and one fits and the other one doesn\'t, they make good gifts.For reference the XL\'s are the:  Copper Canyon Plaid(not washed and dried yet) All the rest have been washed and dried many times:  Midnight Army Plaid, Horizon Plaid and the Large Tall is the: Forest Moss Plaid.  The Copper Canyon Plaid and the Horizon Plaid are similar but the Copper is much darker.The light green one called Forest Moss Plaid is the only Large Tall, the other three are XL\'s. After being washed and shrinking they all fit on my wrist perfectly. They just barely cover the heel of my palm and if I raise my arms my wrist is still covered. Again, I\'m 6\'1"']

["Bought this on sale, first time trying Amazon-branded clothing. A pleasant surprise.The arms are pretty thin but seem to be the right length. Overall size maybe very slightly small but not bad. ['I had the olive one froma few years ago and bought the gray because I liked the shirt that much.', 'So I\'m sitting here contemplating the dermatologist\'s orders (rather standard, but in these parts standardly ignored) that every square inch of skin must be covered up when one is out of doors here in lovely uptown Arizona.Well, in a country where most women decline to wear burqas, that\'s not very practical advice... Oh well. Then I remembered: the chambray shirt!Whoa! Literally... Back in the day, when we had a ranch and I used to ride a horse around the boondocks at every possible chance, Phoenix used to host a store called Yellow Front. An odd emporium, it had features of a general store, a Sportsman\'s Warehouse, and a blue-collar worker\'s supply. I bought a pair of saddlebags for Babe there -- very handy! And jeans and bandannas and fishing gear and a felt-covered canteen and...all sorts of cool stuff.One of the cool things you could get there were men\'s blue chambray work shirts. They were cotton plus some kind of synthetic, as I recall -- so you didn\'t have to iron the damn things, the way you had to iron your daddy\'s khaki shirts once a week. And they were the bidness! Loose-fitting even in the smallest men\'s size (which was the only size that would even remotely fit a 120-pound woman), they let air flow all around you (if you left the tails untucked) and so, much like an Arab\'s white robes, would keep you cool on a warm day by blocking the direct sun while creating a kind of natural air-conditioning.Yellow Front, like all things American and Good, is long gone. In the past I\'ve looked for the things at joints like Target and Walmart and found them...disappeared. Hmmm... chambray chAMbray chAMAZONbray! Why the heck not?Off to the Web! Look it up, and lo! Wrangler still makes them!!! And Amazon has got them!HOT diggety DAYum!Order one up. Late this morning, stroll out to the front courtyard to imbibe the remains of the day\'s coffee, and lo! There\'s a package from Amazon. Grab. Rip open. And lo! There\'s a good old chambray shirt.This one\'s fabric is a little heavier gauge than the ones I recall. It\'s 100% cotton. And instead of being made somewhere in New England or the Midwest, it\'s fabriqu√© in Bangladesh, which is too bad. Shame on Wrangler! Still...at least they\'re still making them and shipping them to...Amazon. Yeah.And the "small" size does still fit. A little long in the arms, which as I recall was the case with the original. I used to roll up the sleeves, aping a handsome young man whose style I admired. For an old lady\'s purposes, though, this is...umh, handy, because when left to their own whim, the cuffs slide down past your wrists and cover about half the back of your hand, thereby protecting the supposedly precancerous area from the dreaded sun.This kind of shirt makes a great lounge-around-the-house cover-up when the weather\'s cold, too. I don\'t run the heat in the winter -- saving the power then makes it marginally affordable to run the air conditioning in the summertime. So what\'s needed here at the Funny Farm is something to keep off the chill that can be run through the washer and is not too fancy to wear while gardening and cleaning the pool and scrubbing down the kitchen and is sturdy enough to hold up to said activities. For the summer: all of the above, except substitute "keep off the sun" for the first desideratum.Just the ticket.Heh. Wrangler. I used to wear Wranglers jeans. That was SO outr√©! Lawyers\' wives did not wear Wranglers. No, nooo, dear, it was just not done! At the worst, you could wear Levis, but even that...tsk tsk. If it cost less than $50, it was just...no.Well, being the sassy little broad that I was, of course I wore Wranglers, because the things fit. Levis do not fit a 120-pound woman with a 130-pound rear-end. :-D Do not now, did not then, never will. Wranglers would fit real women, and they fit women who were given to riding horses. Not only could you breathe in the things, you could swing your leg up over a saddle and push yourself clear of a horse that was going down or trying to throw you. Not only did I wear the things, I wore them to teach in graduate school. So there!Think I\'ll order up a few more of these fine garments. ['Had to wear white at work. Luckily they\'re buying, so here we are. I like many of you, am shackled by the rules of law. Unfortunately those shackles demand we keep our fleshy meat sacks covered in clothes when we\'re out and about. I\'m not saying I\'d rather be naked, but I am saying I\'d rather never be out and about, but rather inside covered head to toe in the finest Amazon Basics someone else\'s money can afford, so I don\'t have to see anything I don\'t want to. I\'m a grown man, there\'s only so much more of myself I can see. Quite frankly I\'m tired of it. It\'s all old hat. It\'s not bad at all, maybe not an Adonis anymore, but not too far off. Far enough however, that I\'m reminded that I am nearsighted, glasses aren\'t my jam, and like everything else, my body has betrayed me. Shopping, am I right?Anywho, we all know the deal when we\'re trying to cover our collective shame. Either it looks good and it\'s expensive, or it\'s cheap and it robs you. Those are usually the only two options you get. With that said, this shirt is in a good sweet spot. It\'s cheap, but looks good enough that you don\'t look like a total scumbag walking around in it. No one\'s gonna think, "Oh crap, time to lie and say I don\'t carry any cash. I just gave this guy money the other day. The city needs to do something about this." This shirt is actually on the level, but not so much that you\'ll be asked for money constantly. It\'s like McDonald\'s you can wear, so it\'s good enough as long as you never think about the atrocities that were committed making the thing. Just bury your head in the sand, and everything will be just fine. No no, that\'s not a severed child-sized pinkie, that\'s an iPad girl, now who wants some margz?! It\'s a lot of sugar but every once in a while it\'s okay. Hey hey hey, they got paid, they knew what they signed up for when they decided to exist on the same planet at the same time as us. Now who wants some guac? Tex-Mex am I right? That\'s this shirt.', "First, they are clearly popular and most people l,. including me, think they're great value. Two things to note, first the overall length is pretty short.  I'm only 5'9 and I find them shorter than optimal.  If you plan to wear these tucked into pants, you're going to have problems after they've been washed. Second, the quality of sewing isn't great, one of mine the neck stitching is coming undone after one washing. I have two - grey and blue heather and will buy more if they ever restock my size in navy.", 'This is a great shirt for daily wear as either the main shirt, or undershirt. Fit was as expected, but on the looser side of slim fit clothes. Thick material made this not see through.']

['Very thin shirt', 'It‚Äôs really comfortable. Runs large.', 'I am wearing the Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt right now. It has a ribbed collar and flat-seamed sleeves.WHAT I LIKE:The fit is exactly the same as every other Hanes polo I have worn ‚Äî just order your usual American size. It‚Äôs a standard, traditional fit ‚Äî it isn‚Äôt elastic, form-fitting, or clinging. The polyester fabric is very light and cool with a finish that is smooth, not meshy or lumpy. The finish is a little slippery, but that‚Äôs not a problem for me. I ordered black, which is very dark and opaque (not see-through). The price was very reasonable.I wash the Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt in biodegradable detergent on regular cycle with tap-cold water and maximum spin, and the shirt comes out wrinkle-free. Then I hang it on a plastic hanger on the shower rod and it is dry in a few hours. So that‚Äôs minimal care in my book.If you want to travel with the Hanes shirt, it packs light and hasn‚Äôt wrinkled, yet. If you want a shirt you can rinse out and hang up to dry overnight, this is it.WHAT I DON‚ÄôT LIKE SO WELL:The only thing I don‚Äôt like is that the short sleeves are a little long, reaching to the middle of my elbows. I was going to send it back over the sleeves, but trusted advisors tell me that it looks fine. So, if it looks fine, it‚Äôs OK with me.DURABILITY:I have been testing my Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt by wearing all the time by itself and under a sweater or jacket for warmth. So far, my shirt has not shrunk, wrinkled, snagged, or pilled ‚Äî the seams are still sewn tight. I wish I had longer term durability data for you, but then you couldn‚Äôt be reading my review now.ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES:Hanes Cool Dri polo shirts are made of synthetic polyester with no elastic fibers (like Lycra or Elastane). Polyester fabric is strong, clean, slightly absorbent, slightly shrinkable, and can be recycled. Lots of polyester is recycled from plastic water bottles, so that‚Äôs a good thing. Unfortunately, polyester is not very biodegradable (land fill estimate=100 years), although some bacteria and lichen have been found that degrade them. My Hanes Cool Dri polo shirt was made in El Salvador.RECOMMENDATIONS:Right now, I‚Äôm recommending Hanes Cool Dri polo shirts if you want a super light, inexpensive shirt and don‚Äôt mind the sleeves a little long. If I change my mind or my Hanes polyester polo develops problems, I‚Äôll publish an UPDATE on my Amazon profile page (just click my name).You‚Äôre welcome to read more of my reviews, check for UPDATES, & follow my profile ‚Äî click my name, above.I hope this review has saved you time and has been really helpful. Enjoy!']

I usually order xlarge but the large was a perfect fit all around. This hoodie is medium warm without being overly hot, wind doesn't pass through it and it's light weight to boot. In fact, I'll be getting another one to phase out my old crappy ones. Hey, don't believe me, get one yourself, join Amazon prime membership( ya It rocks, and everything is free fast shipping, it's the best value out there and pays for itself very fast)) and get it on 7-day trial."]

["I really liked the sweater, it's doing great after a few washes. It's warmer than conventional sweaters. It does better than my faux fur and leather coat at making me feel warm, so 10/10 on being a winter sweater.My sister also bought one(black), and the sewing on her sleeves was a little shabby because of the nature of trying to sew two things together without taking a million years to make sure they're perfectly aligned. Mine (gray) was fine though. I normally appreciate the extra length but it's not hard to take the sleeves in a little to make it have that more fitted look. And when I zip it up there's not as much of that dreaded puff that makes me look even fatter. I think it was designed well with a good, deep hoodie that still works when I wear a bun or a hat (If you look closely, it has the middle stripe of extra fabric that makes it actually big enough for heads).Works pretty great in rain, I think because of the thick layers. I've worn it in bad weather like that twice now, and it's kept me pretty good and dry until the outer layer looks like it's gotten fully soaked. So it's good for when you have short walks in anything but the heaviest rainfall in my experience so far.There are two layers throughout the sweater. They're both thick, and the arms don't have the lining on the inside of the torso and hood, but an extra layer of the outside material. I like the decision, the sleeves would have been too cold for the target weather otherwise. Either way, the material does not feel too synthetic in my opinion. I like it.Overall, 10/10. If you can mend this sweater does not take a lot of effort to make it have a more custom fit, and it's well designed. It doesn't fall into the common sweater traps, and it's compensated for the things it can't do (like anticipate every body type on the belly-pudge). I'll probably end up buying another one.", 'Warmth+Style+Quality at Great Price!!!Totally love this jacket!  Purchased two, gave as gifts. (No one likes the hoods that don\'t cover the head nor the ones that have too much extending out in front of the face). The sleeves are comfortable not restrictive, they are the proper length.  The sherpa lining is soft, warm and comfortable and not bulky. This jacket is a total win!', 'very nice sweater for the price. overall the fleece is not tooo thick and not too light . once you wear it feels like a regular hoody in terms of the thickness of material. not sure if this is normal for fleece lined sweatshirt like these, but every now and then i feel the wind through the materials.Tried it on when I first got it > fits like i wanted. ["Took this up to Northstar on a powder day with continuous snow fall. (Awesome day btw!) I have the over the helmet fit.FIT: The fit was great over my helemt. I wish there was also a draw cord for the mask so that it would stay in place.WARMTH AND WIND PROTECTION: Now the Burke was actually warm over my helmet and when I held the mask in place on the ski lift. On top of that it offered good wind protection as long as the mask stayed in place.Waterproofing: It helped me stay dry for sure, but the snow that accumulated on top would freeze of course becayse of the cold conditions. (definitely not for a stormy day but great for any dry day).Overall it's a well made product with good materials. ["So first off, I'm reviewing a jacket I already returned. It's not a bad jacket, and if I wanted this kind of jacket for the fall or spring, I'd've kept it. But it's November and I was looking for a lightweight jacket I could wear as another layer during the cooler months in SoCal.When I took it out of its polybag, I instantly felt the jacket wasn't cotton. I found the label and it confirmed it: 100% polyester. That's for the shell. The cuffs and waist were cotton or a cotton blend, I could tell. I put it on and it fit well and looked great. But it wasn't going to be as warm as I had hoped. So for those two reason, I knew immediately I would be returning it.Finally, I took a photo of the false pockets under the zippers near the neck area. Like other reviewers have said, the zippers function but lead to no pocket at all. I agree with others that it's really silly, because the zippers being there suggests 100% that there'd be useable pockets there. Nope! ['Muy bonito', 'Sometimes it hits me that I never sense I‚Äôm wearing the shirt‚Ä¶.smooth, light, never snags, never cold or hot‚Ä¶.a remarkable product. Doesn‚Äôt retain odor, doesn‚Äôt readily stain.', "Ever since I got this, the sun hoodie has instantly become my go-to for anything in the sun or where I might sweat. I have retired all of my button-up hiking shirts, which are much less comfortable, have less sun coverage, and are covered in unnecessary bits and pieces like breast pockets, collars, pleats, and buttons. The sun hoodie does everything better. The great thing about the hood is not just the coverage for your neck and ears, but the fact that it's thin enough to go under a hat to hold it in place.The Willit is quite a nice product for the price. The fabric is lightweight but still feels substantial, durable, and stretchy. It is very comfortable and has held up well through numerous adventures. I went ahead and picked the lightest possible color to reflect the sun: white. I really like the way it looks, and I went into it expecting it to get stains. Sure enough, it has picked up a few, but that doesn't bother me because it's a rough-and-tumble activity shirt and it gives it some character. It fits well overall, although it does run a bit small. I would recommend going up one size, since you want it a little loose for airflow. My t-shirt size is usually L but I ordered an XL, and I'd say that the sleeves are just barely long enough‚Äîusing the thumb holes feels like it pulls too much and isn't comfortable. One feature I might wish for is a kangaroo pocket, but it's not necessary if you have pants pockets.Highly recommended, get a sun hoodie"]

['I had previously bought a tan pair of these jeans and both are great. I like these relaxed fit jeans because they are very warm, roomy and the pockets are large enough for cell phones, wallets, knives, keys, etc. Other, regular sized fleece lined pants are a little tight on me. Interestingly, the previous tan jeans I bought had a "Wrangler" tag inside the waistband and a "Lee" leather patch outside the waist.', 'Initially, I ordered 35 X 30 due to some reviews saying they run small. That pair turned out to be huge on me!! So, I returned them for a size 34 X 30. Those also were slightly big, but I figured with washing and shrinkage, they would fit. And Amazon handled the exchange flawlessly.', 'Purchased for my elderly and awesome Dad. He loves them and has been wearing them often during this cold season. ['I was shocked when I started shopping for Wrangler\'s for the first time in 2 decades because I\'ve lost a decent amount of weight and my older ones just don\'t fit. To have this many color options available for this "retro" or what I just call Wrangler\'s is their 13MWZ line (yes I know there\'s several styles, but back in the day you were lucky to find anything other than the original indigo, black, a brownish tan and white). I also found a relaxed fit pair of Wrangler\'s with the patch on the rear pocket and having the standard 5 pockets like the 13MWZs have and intend on picking up a pair once they\'re back in stock for my size just to check them out. I also need to get the inseam nailed down, which may require a visit to the tailors as the 36" is a little long while the 34" is just a tad short. The 36" doesn\'t stack as nicely as I\'d like, so unless I can find a 35" inseam actually in stock I think I\'ll have no other option than to hemmed. Other than that they still remain an excellent quality for the price IMHO.', 'I\'m 6\'2" and wear "Big and Tall". The inseam length on these runs long, which is great for me. I would also consider the rise to be longer than other brands/models, again another plus for tall people like me. I wear them every day, every where.', 'These are as good as they get if you want a pair of old-style jeans with a thick and tough fabric. Newer so-called jeans are not real jeans as they are thin and feel like pants. These jeans are thick like they used to be  which I love. My 30x30 size was spot on. Since they are 100% cotton, they might shrink a little bit so size it accordingly. These are 5 stars jeans all the way for me. What more I could say?']

["I wish they came in a size 39, I have been wearing a size 38 but they are to tight so I purchased these jeans in a size 40 thinking they would shrink, well they don't shrink even after washing in hot water and drying on hot.  They are made very well and the material is strong and they look good, but the size I would like for jeans to come in size 39 that one inch makes a hugh difference in the fit.", 'Generally like the jeans. Also it was a bit wide and long. The wide part I resolved with a belt, the long part , I needed to go to the sewer to short them a bit. But this is probably my fault that I did not hit the right size, no complaints for the jeans. Also , and this is a reason for 4 stars, one of the belt side holders detached , needed to go to sewer to connect it back, I think that it was badly sewed in the first place.But what is important to me that the fabric is exactly what I was looking, not too thin and not too thick . I am from warm country (Israel) , and too thick fabric just cant be weared,  and too thin will not hold well. So from this regard it is just perfect', "Pens are awesome! They fit well. They have on a range of sizes. I personally don't like to spend too much time hemming pants for my partner. He needed these for his paramedic job. ["I used to be a Wrangler boy. There were what I always wore as a kid and up to my late 20s. I bought my first pair of Levi's and it all changed. Since then I only buy Levi's. They just fit better and feel better.", 'This version is still available in 100% cotton not that stretchy material everyone else is into these days.', 'Ordered on October 6, 2022 --- Reviewed on 11-27-2022Fits the same as my older Levi\'s, but denim quality is MUCH lower than older Levis, and is actually worse quality overall than most Wrangler brand jeans I\'ve worn recently.The denim is very soft, so they are slightly more comfortable than some other jeans. Durability wise, I don\'t see these lasting more than 1 year for me, and that will be with very light usage, since the durability is highly questionable. The coin pocket is fraying badly already. Inner pocket stitching is also pretty poor quality, which makes me wonder when the hole that WILL eventually develop in the pockets, will cause me to lose things.Outer yellow line stitching is already pulling out in multiple locations around the pockets and lower legs near the ankles. I\'m in urban environments wearing these, not in the forest, or a jungle. I\'m not constantly rubbing up against things, or walking through thorny brush. This kind of wear and tear should not be happening so soon.My wranglers are half the price, thicker, similar softness (maybe 5% less comfortable at most), and are MUCH more durable.I used to love Levis because they fit well, were very comfortable, and were VERY durable.Levi\'s seems to just be riding their old brand name, and have "cheaped out" on the good quality that they were once known for. They fit, and are comfortable, but are clearly designed NOT to last, so you\'ll have to keep buying already expensive clothing over and over. Not acceptable IMHO.I expect a top dollar product to actually be worth top dollar, and these are definitely NOT the same high quality that Levi\'s was once known for.']

['Supplier (Sheplers) was unable to make a simple change immediately after order was placed.', "47MWZ are the best jeans on the market, but you have to get them in rigid/unwashed denim! Trust me on this. Order the size you usually wear in Levi's. No need to size up, because they come sized up already. Just wash them in hot water (yes, I said HOT) two or three times and then a tumble in the dryer and they come out perfect. They still look dark with just slight fading on the creases (you can probably even avoid that by turning them inside out first) but they're now soft and ready to wear. Wear them, don't wash them that often. Try only spot-cleaning the first month or so if you drip mustard on them or something. As long as you don't sweat like a pig in them and then roll around in the mud (with the pigs, obviously), you should be able to wear 'em with minimal washing and they'll last forever. Order them a little long and you can fold/roll them up at the bottom and wear with boots. Crazy how comfy and cool these are while still being nice, tough denim. And cheap!", "The received one was not denim. It's okay except for the point."]

['Seller claims these are 1% elastane.  I\'d bet they\'re a whole lot more than 1%.  They\'re really stretchy.  Feel kinda weird if you\'re used to 100% cotton jeans.  Other than that no gripes.  Fit pretty good. Denim looks good.  I\'ve worn the same size levi\'s 501 jeans for decades, but levis decided to change the way 501\'s fit so I\'ve gone with 511\'s now.  I guess these have a more "trendy" fit.  Even though the "stretchyness" feels kind of weird they\'re actually pretty comfortable.', 'Best jeans that I have bought for a while. Nice streatch and cut for my body shape.', "I've bought Panda, Myers Crescent, and Rinsed Playa. So far I have had no issues with fit, aside from the inseams being a tiny bit inconsistent. However, the fabric used for different colors does feel very different. None felt like proper denim, but I assume that is just how stretch fabric feels. I ordered my usual size in jeans, and they started out a little tight, but have loosened up.Panda:Light-Medium wash blue. They have a slight fade on the knee but nothing too noticeable. The main thing I noticed about this color was the fabric felt very stiff and kind of cardboardy. It was also the thickest of the three, but was probably the least comfortable. It also smelled weird when it arrived.Myers Crescent (these can be found on Amazon on a different 511 page):Medium-Dark wash blue. These were more comfortable than the Panda. The fabric was lighter, but not too light. They would probably be my favorite, but the fake fade around the knee is a little too pronounced for my taste.Rinsed Playa:Dark indigo-ish. Be warned that these don't really look like any of the pictures online. They are greener than other websites show, but bluer than Amazon shows. It looks like the fabrics has blue thread layered over a more green color, and it seems like cameras just have a hard time capturing how the fabric looks in person. I've included a close up picture that is more accurate to real life. I initially thought they were a little too green, but the color has grown on me. The fabric on these was also the thinnest by far. Very comfortable, but so thin that it doesn't feel like denim at all. Also, if you plan on cuffing the jeans, be aware that the color on the inside is quite strange."]

["I found these years ago at Wally World and they were surprisingly the most comfortable jeans I had. I wore them to the point of no longer being serviceable. ['Edit: buy 1 size down from your normal size. I\'m 30x30 but these pants I had to get in 29x30 (after returning the 1st pair).Purchased the 30x30 spruce.I\'m 32" at the waist. My body is female so I know already that I need a fairly small size.I have an old pair of 30x30 Levi\'s. It fits VERY snugly, as in, I sometimes struggle getting my phone or wallet in and out of the front pockets.So 30x30 should fit me fairly well, right?Not this one apparently. I can pull these off without touching the button or zipper.30x30s according to several sizing charts (including Levi\'s) is supposed to be 30", 31" at most, at both the waist and leg.The leg is 30" from crotch to ankle. The waist, on the other hand, is easily 32" and the material is slightly stretchy. The amount of space between my body and the material would be comical if not for the fact I KNOW my wallet and phone are going to continously pants me. Pretty sure shrinkage over time would not solve this issue even if I tried.An inch or two doesn\'t sound like a big difference. Maybe it sounds great to others, but when you are already small and don\'t have that many smaller options, it\'s not cool.I LIKE men\'s pants. They are generally durable and functional, which is my style to a tee.Yeah, I can shop women\'s pants and easily find something that fits but have you had to contend with finding pants with decent pockets? Women\'s pants (and clothes in general) are more often than not about fashion over function. Aka little to absolutely no pockets.I LIKE pockets. I like having my wallet and keys clipped to my belt loop on one side and my phone in the other. I like it when they don\'t fall out of my pockets when I go to get something off the floor. (So back pockets are an absolute no-go even if I felt like I wouldn\'t get pick pocketed, if you\'rewondering about that.)I like men\'s pants because they almost always have deep pockets.I want to wear men\'s pants. I want the small size to be true. I don\'t want my stuff to inadvertently pants me as I walk through the grocery store. I don\'t want to need to wear a belt on something that should fit me.I want reliable sizing PLEASE and THANK YOU', 'My gentleman friend has lost a lot of weight. ['You can probably tell by they yay part I\'m not a man haha I bought these for my husband and to help others ORDER 1 SIZE down unless you have experience with this brand and already know your size. The first time around I ordered a 36x32 his normal size in Levi\'s. Big no no they were HUGE. We since ordered down and found they fit absolutely perfect. Now..What my husband likes:1.Loose in crotch ( and not like stupid mossimo jeans that have an elongated crotch these are cut just right without the extra material)2. More of a low rise - he liked that they say lower and he didn\'t have to pull them up high so he could bend like other jeansOverall, he loves them! The only jeans he use to wear was Levi\'s because those were the only company not making it huggers as he calls em and accommodated him being able to squat or bend down...that is till we found the Lucky Brand 361\'s I highly recommend these if you like jeans to be a little looser fitting and more of a low rise verses way up. We also found success in the 367\'s too which we ordered down a size (36x32 the normal size but in Lycky brand again the 34x32 fit perfectly) Good job I will be back to try other styles when on sale üòä', "After getting Levis jeans in the last couple years that vary WIDELY in quality and size, I decided to give Lucky Brand another shot.  My go-to has always been the 221 Straight, but they have a little too much stretch in them to the point that I can't keep them over my non existent behind as the day goes on.  The 361 (since replaced with the 363) have a similar cut as the 221 but less stretch.  The denim is also a little thicker, which is a huge bonus. The 221's are comfy, but don't really feel like jeans because of the thinner denim. One note on these: They look like more of a boot cut than what you see in the photos.  I don't really mind because I wear a lot of boots, but I would have preferred a straighter leg at the bottom.  Overall, thicker/better denim than the 221, less stretch (but still some) and a nice fit.  If you're between sizes, always go down a size.  Lucky Brand is very generous with their waist sizes.  I may order a couple more of these to tuck away for later because I like them so much and they've been discontinued.", 'Per the Lucky You jeans "what to look for" list, these jeans are fake.  I am DEMANDING my money back.  I only put on and wore one of the pairs I bought.  I was so disappointed they went into the drawer.  Other pairs are STILL in original package.It was in a discussion about the pants that a friend told me how to determine counterfeit.  Stand by.  Interstate Commerce means I not only contact Amazon, but the Federal Trade Commission as well.  Not my first rodeo with unethical sales of counterfeit products.  I should have known right off when the fit of the jeans sucked so bad.  Labeled 30 inch length, they were actually 34+ inch.I don\'t give a dam that the purchase was in February, I demand my money back.The pix:There should be a clover leaf on the button.Only one clover leaf on label at zipperBlack patch dead giveaway.  The brown patch is the real deal.  No clovers on pockets.Pic of the real logo inside.Pic of the fake logo.Call me Don Quijote, you ain\'t heard the last of me.']

Well made. Last a long time and are comfortable.  They don't kill your back when you bend over and have room in the legs for a comfortable fit.  Quality is excellent. ['Everything was as expected look good,fit good', 'Fits as expected but a bit long', 'I own about a dozen pairs of Levi\'s 565, and that\'s the fit I prefer for "going out."  As many Levi\'s loyalists know, however, as of the last few years the Levi\'s brand has gone to hell and different pairs of the same size and model may fit a few different ways, depending on when and where you buy them.  That said, I still prefer the leaner--while not tight--fit and look of the 565 and still wear these when I\'m out on the town, wearing a collared shirt, wearing nicer but non-formal footwear (cowboy boots, slip on loafers, etc.).There is one place, however, where I do NOT want my jeans leaner and tighter and a little dressier, and that\'s AT WORK.  I oversee management and maintenance operations for a commercial/residential real estate division, and that means I can dress somewhat casually (jeans, polo shirt, utility boots) and can also expect to get dirty on some days of the week.  If I\'m going to be in these all day long, I want something comfortable.  I turned my nose at Wrangler for many years, but I realize the error of my ways now:  these Wranglers are the most comfortable jeans I\'ve ever worn.They\'re somewhat baggy--maybe in the ballpark of the Levi\'s 569--but the cut is very different.  More space all around but they\'re also shaped in a way that allows more freedom of movement.  I also wear a lot of tactical cargo pants at work, and these Wranglers are similar.Also, I don\'t know how they accomplish this on brand new jeans, but they come feeling like jeans I\'ve been breaking in for years.  Every guy has one or two pairs of jeans that he\'s had for longer than he can remember; the ones you wear on a lazy, hung-over Sunday afternoon; the ones you throw on when you\'re going out to nowhere special and the only thing you care about is being comfortable.  These are those jeans.Again, these are not pretty jeans.  I wouldn\'t wear them on a date on Friday night with a button-up shirt, ECCOs slip-on loafers and a nice watch.  I certainly wouldn\'t wear them to a nicer restaurant.  But with a black work polo shirt, utility steel-toe boots, Casio G-SHOCK and twelve hours of work ahead of me, there are few choices better than Wrangler.']

Definitely a no go for a p365.", "For a $70 pair of jeans these look nice, are comfortable to fight in, and at first impression  appear to be durable.Full disclosure the true durability is yet to be seen from my perspective. I have ran, fought, carried a gun and climbed in them a considerable amount and they are comfortable for that.They aren't as constricting mobility wise when you have someone in your guard compared to traditional jeans. Triangles, kimoras etc are very easy to do in them. Carrying a gun, mag, knife, and flashlight are all very easy and the design helps a lot for those with that in mind. I love the side pocket. I hate that constricting feeling when you pull someone into your guard and your phone is in your pocket and the side pocket allows for you to strangle a man with your legs and not restrict your mobility-if that's important to you these are great.They also look like a nice pair of jeans. I wouldn't mind having an option to pay a little more for a more high end designer look for these either though so 5.11 if you're listening I think you are missing an opportunity there but they are nice looking.All in all they are everything I expected them to be and they do it well so for that I give it 5 stars. If you want nice jeans you can fight in for <$100 these are sure tough to beat."]

['I have been writing to various tactical apparel companies for years asking if they would venture into making jeans that were not only functional, but made of a material that was lighter than traditional jeans but maintained the durability of denim. The fact of the matter is, even so-called "low-profile" tactical pants are not as low-profile as manufacturers like to think. Just not that many people are walking around in coyote brown or smoke gray trousers, even if they don\'t have a dozen pockets all over the place. Normal people wear jeans, which is why I am glad these have finally made their way to the market. If you need to present a casual look but maintain a very minimal level of functionality, you cannot go wrong with these.The main problem was, all the "other" tactical jeans were "straight" or "classic" fit. So when I tried those on I looked like I raided my wifes skinny jeans from her closet. Not only is slim fit unprofessional looking, it really restricts movement and you can\'t fit anything in your pockets, unless you want to put your smartphone in your back pocket the way your teenage daughter does. For whatever reason, the makers of these tactical jeans just were not understanding that the average wearer of these is probably going to have larger thighs, hamstrings, and calves, disproportionate to their smaller waist size.So that brings me to the first part of the review where I will actually talk about these jeans. Vertx had the good sense to make these relaxed fit, not straight fit or classic fit or your wife\'s jeggings fit. Now I will say they could still be just a tad bit looser in the upper leg, as I went up a size from my normal relaxed fit jeans and although I am swimming in the waist of the jeans, they fit properly around my upper legs without being overly tight or baggy. I can put something in my front pockets and its not printing through my pants like I\'m wearing spandex. The leg opening is a good width, again I prefer a little bit wider leg opening at the cuff, but these still do not look like the "other" jeans out there where the leg is the same width all the way to the cuff and just looks silly. So although I would prefer these to be just a little more relaxed than they are, no other jeans out there can compare. So I recommend going one size up. (For reference, I\'m 6\' tall 220lbs.)I am a fan of the material, these jeans appear durable but have some slight stretch to them, all without feeling too soft and flimsy or like traditional denim that is heavy and takes a day and half to dry when wet. I\'ve only worn them a couple times so far out and about, so I can\'t speak to how much punishment they\'ll actually take. However they seem well made.The colors are a bit of an interesting choice. You can choose from dark wash or dark stonewash. I got one of each and honestly they look pretty similar to me. If anyone from Vertx ever reads this, PLEASE make a light (read: very light) wash version of these! This is a trend I noticed with all the other tactical jeans out there: for some reason dark wash is the only color available. ['The last four pair of wrangler shorts I have bought have torn along seams near pockets and along the waist band within two to five wearings. I used to get two to three years before I had to replace my Wranglers. The material feels thinner and the stitching is obviously inferior. I work a desk job. I am not doing construction or catching my belt loops on hooks or nails.  I have seen the same trend in the textile industry with socks, undershirts, towels, bathroom rugs, washcloths and dish cloths to name a few. The stitching comes apart soon after the second use, and socks have holes by the third wearing. They should as they feel paper thin. I think it is the thread count which feels very low. Same with these shorts. There is no such an thing as high quality any more.', "I hope they fit. I'll send them back if they don't.", 'I like that it has a cell phone pocket and i use these shorts as part of my everyday attire.']

['I waited on this review to see how these shorts worked out.  They are just the right size, not too short in the leg and plenty of room in the waist.  I wore them all summer and they were great and at at this point still look brand new.  In my mind these are perfect, they have a little pocket for your phone (one on each side) as well as cargo pockets on both sides.  I ordered a second pair after I got these.  I am sold on these.', 'Some of the colors are really comfortable, while others feel more like swim trunks', "I have never encountered this issue until now and I have been buying Wrangler shorts with cell phone pockets for many years. They are the best shorts out there, hands down.The cell phone pockets are not wide enough for me to fit my cell phone in. Pockets, as in, there are 2 cell phone pockets. 2. Not 1, but 2. Usually, these types of shorts only have 1 cell phone pocket. Sometimes the cell phone pocket is on the right (as it should be, I'm right-handed) and sometimes on the left.Fine, that I can live with that little issue. It's a minor inconvenience at best. However, 2 cell phone pockets that I can't use is mind boggling. If these shorts weren't so damn comfortable, I would have returned them. Yup, them. I bought 2 pairs, oops. Live and learn, yes?Now, if I take my cell phone out of the protective case, then I can 'barely' fit the cell phone in the cell phone pocket. It doesn't matter if it's the right or left cell phone pocket. Both are the same.Now, why would I do that? Where would I keep the protective case? In another pocket? I shouldn't have to do that ever. These are near flawless shorts. Fix this one problem and they will be flawless.Edit.Out of the two I bought; one has the right sized cell phone pocket. Still, it should be 2/2 not 1/2. If it happens again, I will return them and buy another pair and hopefully the cell phone pockets will be big enough for a cell phone. Good thing about Amazon, you return stuff if it's not what you paid for."]

I don't find it comfortable but I dislike the feel of all 'plastic clothing' next to my skin. Small holes have also developed in the material where there is no obvioius source of abrasion.So, if your situation requires an adaptive item like this then these shorts might suffice for a relatively short time- if you carefully pull the sides apart. ['Good price point', 'Had my  shorts for a couple of weeks now, thought I would take a close look at how they were sewn, in several locations they were double stitched which of course is a bare minimum of how a good pair of shorts should be made.Durability wise they aren‚Äôt all that fantastic although nothing has fallen apart they were a lot of pieces of loose thread, One of the drawstrings on the right leg looks like it had been chewed up on one side but it was not a game changer for me, I bought these shorts for work so I know they will get a little messed up and what is with that small zipper pocket?
