One, the internal waist band elastic is better than the old style side adjuster tabs on the  traditional BDU shorts. More comfortable as well. Second, the cargo pockets have an extra pocket with open top to tuck your cellphone or a clip-style pocketknife into. Third, on the outside of the cargo pocket there is a small velcro pocket, not found on the original BDU pants. Fourth, inside the waistband is an inner button closure. This is in addition to the heavy-duty snap closure. The button is a traditional BDU pants button, which is a nice touch. Other points... The quality of the fabric is very good, nice and not too heavy, with nice stitching.. There is also a purpose-made knife pocket just behind the front pocket near the side seam, it fits my small pocketknife but may be a bit too small some of the larger folders. This is my new standard for shorts... I'll probably buy 2-3 more pairs and get rid of all my worn out BDU shorts. In case you didn't figure it out, I highly recommend these shorts. I purchased these with my own money, and I receive no renumeration for this review.", "These were gifts for the men in my family who work outdoors in the summer and wear through shorts frequently. All the pairs purchased are still going strong a couple years later, no fraying or fading. I keep ordering more when they are on sale for more pairs in the wash rotation. They don't stain easily, are lightweight and cool. One pair of these equals 5 pairs of traditional khakis for my husband and the pockets are more suited to his use. Definitely recommend.", "Review of the Khaki Color: I've owned my first pair of these for nearly seven years. Lost my second pair. Just bought a third pair. My first pair I wear every day. I wear them baggy like with high top sneakers baggy. I bought the new pair in the same color because theres a obvious stain on my first pair recently. I hike, bike ride, run, do parkour, rock climb, work on my car, and done many different highly physically strenuous jobs in my shorts... For seven years... They are loaded up with many edc items in all pockets. Theres one tiny hole in my keys pocket. Which has been my keys pocket since i bought my first pair... After seven years. These are set and forget. Wear them to any occasion you would put shorts on for literally any. Appropriate for all occasions from rock climbing to Job interviews. My first pair will continue to be my daily drivers for years. This new pair is just for when i want to look a little nicer. Wish I could get a pair of shoes to last this long.**oh, and the phone pocket behind the cargo pocket is new. It reduces functionality of the cargo pocket. Can no longer use one of the Magazine dividers for my 3-in-1 defense spray without causing the phone slip behind the pocket to deform visibly. Ive adjusted my carry but now in order to get the clean lines i feel the papper spray rub against the side of my knee. With my first pair i always forget i even have anything in my pockets theyre so awesome."]

['I always buy a couple because I use them for work. (In the Caribbean) They are worth the money, light weight, strong, plenty of pockets and dry quick.', "First off, I am not the kind of person who would pay $50 for shorts, however after researching tons of shorts online I came to the conclusion these may be the only ones that had the features I wanted (Quick dry, look nice, not long but not super short). I have worn the shorts for about 34 days our of my 40 days of study abroad and exploration of Europe and they have gone above and beyond my expectations. Here's why:1) They are comfortable (not basketball shorts comfortable) but still pretty damn comfortable. I've walked roughly 25-50 miles over my trip so far and these bad boys felt great. A little stretchy and good length in my opinion just covering the knees or slightly above the knees how I like my shorts.2) They don't small (normally this wouldn't be an issue but when you are backpacking through Europe you don't always have a place to wash your clothes. I honestly think I could have gone the whole trip without washing this (I didn't test that theory through) I washed these about once a week, but even after a week of heavy walking no odor at all.3) They look good. These are no dress shorts (are there such a thing?) but they look great with a button up and tennies.4) The lower side button pockets are great for holding whatever you need and I never lost anything from them during the trip even when sitting, standing, running, etc.Improvements:There are awesome shorts and I plan to pick up one other in another color but HH could improve them still.1) Side pockets don't work well (not sure if they could make them deeper or reshape them) but they just don't do the job. Nothing really fits and when small thins do fit they would fall out most times I sat down.2) They take longer to dry than I had hoped. I wanted these to be shorts I could wear to the river or beach and be dry by the hike back but they take over a day or two (depending on temperature) to completely air dry. Not a big deal but if you are reading this HH you could make these bad boys even better.3) Back zip pocket is great for documents small paper (very flat stuff) but doesn't work for much else. It's also very long which is a little strange (no complaints) just think it could be better somehow.Well there you have it these are the best multiple purpose shorts I have owned to date in my 27 years on this earth and I highly recommend them to anyone who is looking. They seem like they could last forever with proper wash and dry care and I look forward to test this out by wearing them even when I return from backpacking.Great job HH thumbs up over here.", 'Great fit and very comfortable!']

["I've been looking for good cargo pants for a while. These are great! Fit perfect, appear very well made.", 'Live, work and play in a South Florida subtropical climate. These lightweight, comfortable, versatile and highly functional shorts fit the bill perfectly for this challenging, high heat/humidity environment. Working in a law enforcement capacity, I have purchased many  5.11 brand products (nearly all from AMAZON) for work/play and have been extremely pleased with the high quality, durability and performance from all of these purchases in the field. These shorts are no exception and I am extremely pleased with how they look, feel and perform in the field.The well designed and laid out 8 pockets of these shorts allow for efficient organization/storage of all of your tactical/field gear (knives, flashlights, cell phones, magazines). The 4 slash pockets (2  front shallow with velcro security and 2 rear with deeper length) allow for quick and easy access to your gear.  The rear trademarked tactical canvas strap and front D-ring allows you additional attachment points for other gear you want to access quickly. The heavy duty, double bartacked large belt loops allow extra durability to use various tactical belts (prefer 5.11 in this area too) to effectively support/carry your gear.The fit and feel of these shorts is nearly perfect and I feel is true to size.  I wear a Medium 32-34 in most shorts and purchased size 34 in the Khaki color and they look and fit me great. I am just shy of 6\' and 175 lbs. and the 9.5" inseam fits me just above my knees similar to the picture. As other reviewers have commented, they are not completely form fitting, close to your body but somewhat loose fitting - especially in the crotch (probably due to the built in double reinforced triangular gusseted material) but they are not baggy looking unlike other brands of tactical shorts and pants I have purchased.  In short, they are designed to be loose in the areas you want to allow for extra freedom of movement and form fitting in other areas.If you do not like the fit and appearance from the 9.5" leg length you may want to order the 11" inseam for more leg coverage.  The action elastic comfort stretch band in the waist allows for a little extra expansion for movement and for an IWB CCW (small weapon) and or a heavy meal!  The poly/cotton 6.14 oz. ripstop fabric is very durable and lightweight and nearly wrinkle-free. The Dupont Teflon stain protector keeps them from becoming easily stained in the field. I also use them as hiking/trekking shorts and they perform beautifully and are the best I have found for this purpose.I do not know of any UPF factor on these shorts for those who are concerned about sun safety. Due to polyester fabric blend of these shorts,  I would say the sun protection factor they provide is fairly high - at least UPF 30 - but this is just a guess on my part based on other similar blended UPF fabric shorts/pants that I have purchased. This is an issue for me and a factor in buying due to subtropical climate in which I live and work and maximum sun exposure to harmful UVA/UVB rays in this type of environment.Other great and high quality features are the YKK zippers and PYRM snap in the fly area and the cordura reinforced pocket edges to prevent the pockets from tearing when you attach your knife or flashlight in these areas.In summary, I truly believe the Taclite Pro Shorts from 5.11 are the "best of breed" as far as tactical shorts brands go and are probably the most perfectly designed, functional and highly performing shorts that I have ever purchased.Additionally, they are extremely comfortable to wear and are made from a lightweight breathable fabric which performs excellently in a warm, humid climate.  If you need something heavier and warmer I recommend their regular tactical shorts which I believe has a 8.5 ounce fabric.While they are not inexpensive- AMAZON - has the best pricing, I believe in the motto " you get what you pay for" and I think this truly applies to this product. I highly recommend them to you for use in the field or in tactical, warm weather climate. I know I will be purchasing several additional pairs (different colors) in the near future.', "Normally wear a 40 but had to get 44s...originally got 42 but they are really snug in the thighs (I'm 6'3, 300 lbs.)."]

["This is NOT Versace...so let's be real. This is a low-end party jacket. However, for what it is, it looks GREAT! The cut is very flattering. For fast fashion this is above average quality.Now is it top of the line, high end? No, but that's not what it's trying to be.  But it is comfortable and well made.  I imagine this will be perfect for a one time even or infrequent wearings."]

['I‚Äôm a female 5‚Äô3 100lbs.I‚Äôm comparing three vests all size Small. I wanted to get a green Harrys tweed vest. Mostly, I was looking for a heavy vest to help with the winter in Missouri. So far, none of the options have a Harrys tweed logo.The Irish Celtic Ranch weights 10 1/2 oz. =290grsThe Vaboom weights 11 1/2oz =326grsThe Onlylover weight 11oz 313grs, which is surprising since it has a satin back.The Emerald Isle was the heaviest with 11 5/8oz =329grs. Its has tweed on front and back and is the only  one that came with an extra button.None of these vest have internal pockets. The Irish Celtic and the Emerald Isle have 4 external pockets, which is nice. All pockets are closed, just use a needle to open them up. Avoid using a pair of scissors, you don‚Äôt want to risk cutting the fabric by mistake.The Onlylover and the Voboom can be stretched  by pulling the two straps on the back (see photo). Unfortunately, the Irish Celtic and the Emerald Isle have only one strap to pull on the back, which means you get half of the stretch.Onlylover seems wider than the other two, specially by the shoulders. Irish Celtic and Voboom had the same wide. See picture comparing Onlylover with Irish Celtic.Except for Onlylover, they all have 5 buttons on the front. Only lover has an extra button located possibly to hold a pocket watch.Reading the reviews on all these products, I thought getting a small size would fit me well enough. Most people complained about the vests being too small. Well, none of these vests are small enough to fit me. I guess reviews depend on the eyes of the beholder.', "Love the vest. Bought it for a wedding and got it at the last minute. Was really hoping it would fit well and it did. I removed the little threads that hold the front pockets shut and it was easy enough to do. The material is nice, and thick, so it doesn't feel cheap. The stitching is strong and not cheezy. I told my wife that being a person who values quality, I've worn it with a feeling of pride. I had some good comments on it and was happy about that as it made me feel good about my choice. Shopping for some additional variations...", "Everything I was looking for in a traditional tweed vest. Love it.  But two stars off because I cannot get the pockets open. I know the pockets are there but are stitched so tightly with matching thread that I'm not able to distinguish the closure thread from vest material."]

['I like the materialIt fits for a slim person', "My husband needed a suit.  He usually takes a 38 coat and 33 pant so I decided to give this suit a try.  Let's take a look.HOW THIS COMESThis comes on a really nice hanger that holds the suit shape nicely.  It is covered with a high quality clear plastic bag over top too for hanging and keeping it dust free.FABRICThe fabric of this suit is beautiful.  It has the wrinkle free texture of poly, but the soft drape and flow of the viscose.  It is a VERY fine twill weave.COLORThe color is a beautiful charcoal gray.STYLEThe style is really nice.  It is a silmmer cut, so if you are more prone to the beefier American cut, this suit might not work for you.  If you are the type who is looking for a flattering European cut, this suit might be just the right style for you.COATThe coat has pockets sewn shut (you will have to take out the stitching when you want to wear this as is customary with tailored clothing).  They are well made and at a good angle and size.  There are three inside pockets which are also beautifully made and styled into the inside of the coat.LININGThe lining of this coat is beautifully sewn.  In some parts, the lining is hand sewn into place, adding a real beautiful touch to this jacket.  The sleeves are lined in white, and the quality of the lining is professional quality.PANTSThe pants have 2 buttons and a hook on them.  There is an inside button and outside.  There are slash pockets which are deep enough not to have things falling out.  The back pockets will have to be opened as they are temporarily stitched shut as with most tailored clothing.  The bottoms of the legs are unfinished and you have to have them hemmed.  The back at the waist has the capacity to expand bigger by about an inch and a quarter or so.FITMy husband usually wears a 38 regular coat and 33 pants. He has a little tummy now, where he used to be very flat and European cut all of the way.  This suit is a bit snug on him as far as the coat goes, but the pants have plenty of room in them and can be made bigger if needed.  This suit is very flattering and cut well.  We got a 40R and the pants are 34w.THE BOTTOM LINEThis suit is an excellently sewn suit.  It is really beautifully made.  The fabric is very nice and the quality of construction is high end.  It is definitely a slim suit, but it is well made and styled.MY RATINGFIVE STARS.  This suit is a bit slim for my husband but we will make it work.  It is well made and the style is great.PHOTOSI have taken many photos of the suit, but could not get my husband to model it yet.  If I do, I will try to add those photos to this review soon.  I wanted to get it posted because this suit deserves to be looked at and considered.  The last photo I posted is of the center back seam in the pants so you can see how much there is to expand if needed.", 'QUICK SUMMARY: I selected 44R / 38W but I\'m 6\' 2" tall. My bad, I should\'ve ordered the 44 Tall. So the suit coat is too short, the suit coat sleeves are too short. I can\'t downgrade my star rating because I ordered the wrong size, though. I gave it 4-stars because it would be better to have the pant length be hemmed rather than unhemmed, because of the expense and extra effort to get the pants hemmed to whatever you want.WHAT I LIKE:- The black suit coat and pants were what I expected (black, not charcoal)- The suit coat was nicely put together, with inside pockets and nice feel- The 44 coat size fit me as expected- The 38 waist size fit me as expected (tight for a 38-inch waist, but it is a "slim fit" product)WHAT I DIDN"T LIKE:- I didn\'t like the way the slim fit pants felt on my upper thighs. Something about how it\'s sewn together makes it feel weird on my legs. I don\'t usually buy slim fit items, though, so it\'s probably a function of how the pants are sewn for a tight, athletic fit.- If the waist size of the pants is a function of the suit coat, you might as well take a guess at the length of the pants and have them come hemmed rather than unhemmed. No matter what your pant length is, you have an extra expense and effort to get your pants hemmed (unless you\'ve got a family member, friend or significant other who\'s willing to do this for you - or if you can do that for yourself).CONCLUSION: I\'m tempted to get the correct-sized item (44 Tall / 38 waist) just to get a cheap suit in my closet for those very few times I need a suit (weddings, funerals). This is great suit for a college student who\'s graduating and needs some wardrobe items for that first in-person interview.']

["Had to go to a fancy summer wedding in LA at a famous hotel. The 1st thing I was worried about was catching COVID-19 and/or diarrhea. I didn't want to look like I was copying the groomsmen, look too casual or formal, and wanted to feel comfortable with hanging out with my wife the rest of the night while she was in formal bridesmaids gown. I found this companies jackets on Amazon, and even though it's from India, the shipping was fast and the sizes were correct,  at least for me. The jacket was vivid blue, with black checkers. It was trim, and flattered my dad bod, even though I don't have kids. I had to mingle with several big timers, parents, and got so many compliments, then drunk I spilled the beans and told everyone how inexpensive and non-taylored the jacket was. ['I am very impressed by the jacket.  Much heavier material than I was anticipating.  The material is probably 3/16" thick.  I live in MN and it could comfortably be worn in the winter months.  For the price, I would certainly buy again.  The only reason why I didn\'t give this a 5 star rating is that its color is advertised as "tan." I have a bit of a belly, but had room to button the jacket-wasn\'t tight.I was hoping for a more woven material also, so it is a little different, but it works just fine. Heavy enough for the Fall weather up here in Northern Wisconsin. I am pleased with this purchase...', 'I really want to like this. It does look fairly nice for the price. My wife even liked it.But, looking at this, I kind of expected a tweedy, woven texture to the herringbone fabric. Instead, it is a tufted texture, kind of like velvet or a very low pile wool rug. I won\'t say that this is good or bad. It feels nice. I suspect it won\'t wear very well with a lot of use though.The description of the sizing is dead on. This is the "standard fit is slim and slim is skinny" kind of sizing. If that works for you, you  might be fine. In my case, it means the shoulders fit especially poorly, the sleeves are so long it\'s better to return this than tailor it, while the body is fine. I might give it a shot one size down, but I suspect the body might be a bit tighter. Your mileage may vary of course.']

["I was looking for a new black suit jacket that fit me well - I am pretty athletic/fit with a trim build (which apparently means a bit bigger chest and a lean torso/build per the suit sites that I've looked into) so a classic fit suit would be too bulky and a slim fit suit is too slim especially in the chest area. ["My drawer of shorts is a hodge-podge of paris from the usual sources, Gap, Dockers, Izod, Banana Republic, Old Navy and Tommy Hilfiger. Up until a year or two ago these pairs were for the most part interchangeable, mostly khaki, flat front, 100% cotton and unless you looked at the label you would never know the brand.  Suddenly things are changing.  Shorts are now 90% to 98% cotton and a few percent Elastane, Lycra, Spandex for some manmade fabric for stretch and/or wrinkle control.  This pair is 98% cotton 2% elastane making it a little softer and stretchier.  The pockets are lined with a nylon like mesh similar to a bathing suit that hopefully will stand up to my wad of keys longer than the thin white cotton that usually comes in shorts.  The inner waistband is better finished. Is this supposed to be a shirt gripper like a pair of Bonobos pants?After I somehow lost seven pounds I found my old 34 waist pants falling down unless I wore a belt.  I ordered these in 33 waist and they fit well.  Since the waist has some expandability, if you are on the border between two waist sizes you can go with the smaller one.  If I gain a few of those pounds back I think these will still fit.Amazon Wardrobe is simply brilliant in its elegance and execution.  On the front end you forgo prime shipping for Amazon Wardrobe Shipping and your order may take an extra day or two to arrive.  Perhaps that savings to Amazon funds the process of not billing you until you tell them you want to keep the item or your decision window expires.  If you don't like it just put it back in the provided special bad that has an extra unused peel and stick flap and let Amazon know.  This takes all of 2 minutes and is free.  To return to Macys, Nordstrom, Banana Republic, you have to visit a website, remember your login, puching your order number, print a mailing label, tape the label to the box and in most cases have return shipping subtracted from your refund.  Amazon. This is the way.", "Earlier versions of Dockers shorts had a really good, easy to use, phone pocket. This is a very important feature for me. With my phone in a case, it's hard to get the phone fully into the pocket on these. Then it ends up behind the right hand pocket, making the pocket less functional.", 'Good value']

['My husband asked for these for Christmas. He prefers to not wear shoes in the house, so these are super quick for him to slip on and take the trash out, bring the dog in, get something from a vehicle, or get something from the garden. He says they fit very comfortably and they are much more substantial and comfortable than slippers for all the little things he uses them for. He also likes to wear them in the truck when he goes hunting and then he can put his giant hunting boots on when he arrives. It‚Äôs quicker than having to untie shoes. I thought it was a silly gift request, but so far they are winners for him. Our teenage boys keep taking Dad‚Äôs so we bought a pair for them too. Crocs for the win.', "I had foot issues until is switch to Altra brand shoes that have Zero Drop and more importantly wide toe boxes to give my toes room to spread out and breath.  A lot of people think the same things about those as Crocs (they look like clown shoes, etc.).  My feet (top) and ankles do swell throughout the day.  I wanted to try something that was even less restrictive on the top for around the house or even the beach or pool.  I had to order a size up to deal with the swelling so there is extra space in the toe box, but my foot isn't sliding or moving around all so they have been great so far.  As long as they don't stretch enough that my foot starts sliding I think I have a good alternative that is waterproof when needed.", "These are Crocs, so you already know they're excellent quality. My only issue is that they're only true to size if you're not using them in sports mode as the strap is not as long as the shoe itself and it's not made from a stretchable material. The listing says to go a size down and I'm a 7 1/2, so I ordered a size 7, and sports mode was too tight and uncomfortable for me. I returned them and ordered a size 8... Still too tight for me to wear for more than a couple of minutes. I returned them once again and got a size 9 (a size and a half up from my usual size) and finally, I can wear them in sports mode comfortably. So, if you're like me and like having your shoes secured on your feet, you might need to get a bigger size."]

['I did mess up on a prior pair that I ordered for my husband as I did not realize they were vented in the bottom sole of the shoe.  The first time my husband wore them in the rain, it was quickly brought to my attention that he did NOT want this exact kind of Hey Dudes again...', "Hey Dude‚Äôs are comfortable canvas shoes. It that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for, you need to give them a try. Lightweight and breathable, they also offer nice support. ["I wear a 10.5 but since these come in whole sizes I went up to 11. Over-all the fit is good. I bought regular width even though I typically buy wide in other shoes. I cannot speak to the durability because I've only had them 1 week. They are comfy and keep my feet warm. One area of concern to pass on to others is the 'bead' around the opening or 'neck' of the slipper. It is quite firm and not forgiving when new. I have what I consider to be a high bridge on my foot. So, even though I went up a little on size it was still a little difficult to get my foot in the slipper. It did loosen up a bit in the past week so I assume it will become more loose in time. All together, it is a comfy slipper, and warm. If you want more ankle warmth get the boot style. I cannot wear socks with this slipper. I am told by my girlfriend they aren't designed to wear socks with Uggs.", 'Bought it for my teenage daughter per her Christmas request. She didn‚Äôt know what color she would get and loved the white. However, I had to buy a men‚Äôs size and went with a size down. Was worried it would be too big, but they fit perfect with her thicker winter socks. Note:  I did also purchase suede protect, and she put two coats on.', 'scrolling on amazon 2 days before christmas looking for a last minute gift for my uncle. all of a sudden these popped up with one size left‚Ä¶ AN 18!! He says he loves the shoes and that they‚Äôre super comfortable. he doesn‚Äôt get shoes in his size often so im glad he enjoyed them.']

["eff loved his Hey Dude shoes. They were the most comfortable shoes he had ever owned, and he wore them everywhere. He wore them to work, to the park, and even to bed.But as time went on, Jeff realized that his Hey Dude shoes were too comfortable to own. He found himself spending more and more time in them, and he neglected his other shoes. He stopped going to work, stopped going to the park, and even stopped going outside altogether.Jeff's friends and family became concerned. They tried to get him to take off his Hey Dude shoes, but he refused. He was too comfortable, and he didn't want to give up that feeling.Eventually, Jeff's friends and family staged an intervention. They came to his house and forcibly removed his Hey Dude shoes. They took him outside, and they showed him all the things he had been missing out on.Jeff was shocked. He realized that he had let his Hey Dude shoes take over his life, and he had missed out on so much. He vowed to never let that happen again, and he started to live his life to the fullest.In the end, Jeff learned that even the most comfortable shoes can be too comfortable to own. He was grateful for the intervention, and he was determined to make the most of every day.", 'At first I did not like these shoes, only because they do not come in half sizes and sometimes that makes a big deal. I usually wear a 7.5 size shoe and a size 8 usually is ok but these in size 8 were pretty big and my feet got blisters because there was no stability. I ended up putting a couple of those Dr Shcolls pads (The odor eater cheap ones) in each shoe and they made a HUGE difference. I now love these shoes for casual walking around. They definitely are not for long walks but overall they are comfortable and super easy to clean.', 'I ordered in women‚Äôs size based off the sizing guidelines they fit great with socks but without socks as I‚Äôd like to wear them they are slightly too big. Not a big deal I‚Äôll just wear socks. I‚Äôm typically a size 7.5 US size so based off the measurements they recommended at size 8. My next pair I‚Äôll order the 7‚Äôs. Overall I love them']

["A few facts:1)  I had extreme pain on my hips and needed hip surgery, but after wearing this slipper for a week my hip doesn't hurt and no more surgery.2)  My legs were misaligned from wearing unsupported arch shoes. You can tell by observing the bottom of your shoes. If the outside os the edges of the heels are worn-out, then your legs are not align straight. This means that you've been putting pressure not on the arch part, so eventually your hip and knees will hurt. However, this shoes allows me to walk on my arch part of my feet. As as result, this posture places the pressure in the center, which allow me to stand straight and my legs are aligned properly so that my joints don't hurt.Please note that this is my personal experience that I'm sharing. I ended up purchasing sneaker and Clogs for all my family members. I hope this helps. So, do I recommend to others, YES!!!!!", 'I bought these to use for house  slippers w/ socks. I could not find a house shoe to provide support.I love these. Just spent 10 hours on my feet in $450 insoles & ended up w. Very hurt feet. I got instant relief that night & wearing all day today. Foot pain gone. They are truly recovery shoes!I have 4 pairsNote: Not to be worn in wet areas. Get slicker than snot. Also check their size chart to help w. Better size ordering.', 'I normally wear a 6 and 1/2 to 7 size shoe. I ended up having to get the size 8 because these run a bit small. Even at a size 8 the top of the shoe rubs my foot a bit, so I tend to wear socks with them. These were recommended by my podiatrist for plantar fasciitis and they are worth every cent.  I was a bit doubtful when I saw the price for what looked like cheap plastic shoes, but they are so comfortable I wish I could wear them everywhere. I wear them around the house because I was told to not walk barefoot on my hardwood floors. I highly recommend these.']

['My husband wears a 13/14 so finding shoes in his size is not an easy task.To my amazement I‚Äôve been able to find his size in most stores and online for hey dudes.After my husbands first pair he‚Äôs officially hooked. I plan to buy more of these.', 'Really comfy and easy to slip on. I have an upcoming trip where I will be on multiple planes in a day for over 20 hours of flying. Wanted something comfy on those long flights and this is perfect!']

['The quality of theses boots are great but gave me more of construction worker vibes. They don‚Äôt come in .5 sizes needed 9.5 the 10 were too big.', "They seem to have the same build as the other Doc's that lasted 20 years.", 'I work in the receiving area of a large retailer. In the winter I need heavy socks and I have had to wear insoles for cushion and support for a few years. My fee are very wide. I ordered, as usual two sizes too big, to be able to fit all that. These boots are soooooo comfy and supportive, I don\'t think I need my insoles. They fit as I expected, just wide enough and too long. If your feet are "regulat" wide, these will probably fit you. If you wear insoles for any reason other than cushion or arch support, these boots will be tight.  I\'m wearing them today and expect them too be comfy (and too long, as is my fate - my feet are seriously short and wide). If my experience is any different, I will add to this post.Ok - These boots give great support - i discovered i don\'t need my inserts. I have bursitis in my heels and might eventually need some additional squishy there but the sole of thes boots is great. SO. I spent the last month exchanging and exchanging (i love Amazon) to figure out what my real size is. I got them and love them. If you\'re switching from regular docs, the leather is much stiffer on these and the boots are heavier. And the sole is more everday working on your feet with heavy stuff friendly. My feet are very wide so with the stiffer leather i am having a but of breaking in which i never had with my other docs. If you have extra extra eide feet that might be a problem. Overall these are great boots for work. Big thumbs up!']

["These have broken in pretty well. At first they were not the most comfortable but I gave them a shot and they are working pretty well now. They do well as house slippers in keeping the toes warm which was the whole point of getting them. The sole is a good rubber and gives a good grip even on a little water or snow. They are easy to slip on and off and easy to wipe clean. The foot has a memory foam kind of cushion but around the outside where it is stitched the padding is much thinner (maybe as part of the construction?) so its a weird feeling until everything breaks in and even then its still noticeable. The sizing is a little weird, it seems wider in the middle and then more narrow at the toe? Again after wearing them for a bit they are fitting to my foot much better. With a pair of wool socks these fit well for me and have done their job in keeping the feet from freezing even in this storm we've been having when visiting the in-laws with temps at and under 0 degrees. They could be better but for what they are they do alright, a good basic house slipper. Hope this helps.", "Upon receiving this item, I was dismayed because it was just slightly too small. I even started a return and ordered a larger size, hoping that they would fit better.Well, imagine how dumb I felt when I was boxing them up to return them and noticed that the liner had been crumpled way down into them, making them almost impossible to see. And, with my thick socks, I failed to feel them at all.So, if they don't fit at first, check way down in them to see if the liner has been crumpled up and is causing them to fit poorly.After removing said liner, it was like angels caressing my sore feet.", 'I‚Äôm a size 10 and bought the 9.5-10.5 size. The fit is perfect. They provide nice warmth during the colder months. The nice fit makes them comfortable walking around the house, including on smooth surfaces and up and down stairs.']

["My biggest issue with ordering shoes online is the somewhat inconsistent sizing between different brands, but these fit exactly as I would expect them to (the same as my previous running shoes, which were Nike).Other info: they only take a day or two to break in, tread on the bottom is above average (but nothing incredible) and padding/ heal support is just average. They're also flat inside so if you're someone who needs arch support you might want to look elsewhere or buy different padding inserts (but for me that's irrelevant). Overall a solid and slightly above average workout/ running shoe, so I'm inclined to give it 5 stars because I got them while on sale and they're definitely worth like the $40 ish that I paid for them.", 'I\'ve owned a pair for six months now, and I\'ve gotta say, these are some quality shoes! As expected from Under armour, all this time and they still look new! Just an occasional wipe with water and a cloth and bingo, new. The soles have a little wear, but I do a lot of walking and they already have outlasted my last pair of "sketchy" brand shoes and cost about half. Great shoe! Only con I can think of is the back of the sole had some rings that sometimes create a little suction that is a bit alarming at first wear. Overall I\'d give them a 9/10. Thank you!', "I absolutely love my Underarmour shoes, only beef I have is that I wear a size 11 and these when wearing them make my feet look small. I think it's an optical illusion because I thought size 11 was medium not quite small not quite big. Other than that they're great, comfortable, durable, clean easy. I wear mine primarily to the gym and they pass my rigorous testing. 10/10"]

['After months of complaining to coworkers about my uncomfortable and increasingly unsightly loafers--I finally broke down and purchased a pair of Hey Dude Men\'s Wally Loafers, size 13, color Lunar. These were recommended by a coworker who stated they were "in style."I\'ve worn these twice now (full 10-hour days standing on concrete floors) and can confirm these loafers are quite comfortable and lightweight. ['I was going to order these directly from croc, but wasn‚Äôt fast enough and missed out on my size (they were on sale).  On a whim I checked Amazon and wound up getting them for $1.37 more (including shipping).  Couldn‚Äôt be happier.  My last set of crocs clogs was several years ago a pair of camo ones.  I wore them out and just couldn‚Äôt make myself pay full price for new ones.  I tried a couple of knock offs and they were on.  Didn‚Äôt last as long and weren‚Äôt quite as comfortable.  Decided to buy these for myself as a birthday treat and I am so glad I did.  Fit is perfect (there‚Äôs a fitment chart at the crocs website).  I actually met the delivery person as I was leaving to go shopping- ran back in the house and changed shoes real quick.  Glad I did, I have a peripheral neuropathy and some other medical issues.  Today my feet didn‚Äôt hurt and I felt much better in spite of the distance we walked.  Buy em, you‚Äôll love em!', 'to preface. i bought my husband a pair of crocs all terrain TrueTimber strata clogs from bass pro back in 2020(photo provided), & he had always loved them, but they where extremely loose on him even though they where his size. they where just made to have ample room around the foot & he was looking for something that fit more like a shoe, and not a slipper like for someone whos feet swelled real bad which wasnt his problem, so it wasnt really nessesary to have a shoe that big, & also a bit longer than expected. i ordered these off-road sport clogs, & when he put them on they fit more like a tennis shoe than a slipper, & he is very happy about that. the more you walk in them, the more they conform around your foot shape which i think is really cool. i can literally see the dip of my husbands toes & the top of his foot in the old pair, so if youre worried about them fitting perfectly or feeling slightly snug rather, their suppose to be that way at first until you walk them in, then its like puttin on a winter glove. this version just fit very well, & they made a good chrismas present!!', "Everything about these is favorable other than how hot they can get with or without socks. My feet tend to get a Lil sweaty/stinky after wearing them all day (8+) hours but seeing as how they're comfy and rugged I still rock with them here and there or on weekends banging around the house. They're easy to clean, comfortable and frankly have legitimately no other negative traits. Still would definitely recommend and if you can get them on sale like I did, even better."]

['My son wears a 11, 11.5 or 12 depends on the shoe -  Ordered the 11 and it fits perfect.  Got the all black so he could have something dressy for Band Concert for school and he has to dress up for school sports away games.  Comfy and in style.  Looks good with dress slacks, jeans, and shorts.  All around super happy with our purchase', 'Not as thick and cozy on inside as the second pair of the exact same shoe he got,  only bought from a store.', 'My husband loves the comfort and weight of these shoes.']

['After hearing about Crocs for many years, I decided to try them after an operation for a neuroma on my foot. So I pulled the trigger and got a pair. After donning my new gems we took a road trip. Since this was my first venture out in public wearing them, I was a little unsure of what to expect, andfeeling a bit less manly, as I was walking out of a gas station a HUGE guy (that looked like Grizzly Adams) was walking in wearing a pair of Crocs. We made eye contact and I said  "Real men wear Crocs". He laughed and said they are the most comfortable driving shoes he has ever worn.Tips:Wear them a few hours a day in the house for a few days before venturing out for a day trip. If they still feel tight, heat them up with a blow dryer or clothes dyer (about 10 mins on high). Put them on with a pair or two of thick socks and walk around in them while they cool off. Repeat if still too tight. Too loose? Use the same method but let them cool off before wearing them. With a little experimentation, you can dial them in to fit perfectly. If the little nubs on the foot bed bug you, wear them with socks until they wear down. If you\'re going to wear them with socks (even thin ones), you might want to go one size larger. Glad I got them!', 'Clunky old hunting boats used to frustrate me, and often keep me from pursuing my favorite outdoor activities.  I can now enjoy the comfort of a pair of Crocs while blending in with nature.  Sneaking up on the most elusive of wild game has never been easier, NOR more comfortable, thanks to these Crocs!!  Waiting for Crocs to come out with a steel toe version, so I can wear them to the jobsite...hint hint.', 'Like that I can get these in size 13 and for decent price.  Husband wears crocs all the time, with or without socks.  Bought 2 pair.  Will buy again when he wears these out.']

They are durable and the best thing about this sandal is that they are adjustable. I recommend this vendor, item arrived on time.', "These as a family favorite.  My husband loves them, the boys love them.  We have to buy them in different colors so the boys don't steal my husband's pair. They are very soft and cushiony.  They are durable and last more a season.  The last ones we purchased lasted 2 years, which is saying a lot since they are used every time they leave the house for about 9 months a year."]
['Purchased as a gift and got great reviews for comfort - very lightweight like house shoes', 'Very comfortable', 'Maximum comfort, fit and style!  Highly recommended!']

['I bought these as a gift for my brother and got some honest feedback from him. I was very impressed when I received them in that I am going to myself a pair next time I am do for a pair. The quality felt great, the style was impressive and I can see myself wearing these for multiple occasions.', "I believe another reviewer for these shoes said that they feel like sweatpants for your feet. Can't recall if it was on amazon, but it was certainly an accurate statement.I like to wear flip flops in the summer when I run out to the car, or to the store for a quick errand. I've tried various slippers or slip on shoes as replacements for the colder months, but none of them really cut it.These shoes are perfect, even while its still warm out. Theyre very breathable, but I'm sure they'll be warm enough for quick outings in the winter - especially with thicker socks. They slide right on, and feel so loose/comfy! They do all of that while staying securely on your foot too.I'm the type of person to take my shoes off as soon as I'm in my house - purely for comfort reasons. With these, I tend to keep them on all day. The stretchyness of the fabric does allow your foot to slide off the sides of the sole at times, but this has been helpful to me. Ive been trying to correct my walking form from terrible heel striking, and these have helped me work towards that.Ive had them less than one week and can honestly say theyre one of the best shoes ive ever owned, and certainly the best in their 'category'.I wouldnt wear them for any long distance walking, certainly not for running or hiking, but theyre the perfect casual around the house/around town shoe.", 'Bought these for my husband to wear to a casual wedding. Next thing I know my 15 year old son is wearing them and he has no plans to give them back. He loves these shoes! He wears to school, to the gym and everywhere in between!  He has another pair of Hey Dudes but these are by far his favorite!  Guess I will be buying another pair -or two.']

["These flip flops are well worth the money. I've never been able to walk a far distance in flip flops without my feet hurting. Well not Oofos, I can walk miles. Literally miles and it feels like I have the most comfortable  tennis shoes on but I have flip flops on! AMAZING PRODUCT. ["Love the look and feel, although I'd say they run a tad small. ['High quality.  I bought one last year, still looks new.  No odor with ordering one size larger than your normal shoe size', 'Bought these for my husband for Christmas and he absolutely loves them. His typical size is 13 and the 13 fit him perfectly.', 'My husband loves these slippers! So soft and comfortable. I like how they are quiet when he walks around the house!']

['5 stars ‚Äî glad I purchased these just in time for the Great Freeze of 2022These slip on & off easily, and once on, they stay on. They have kept my feet warm, with or without socks. The traction on the floor is good. They don\'t seem to generate as much static as the pair they replaced, for which my cat is grateful.They are incredibly cozy.I do anticipate two issues. First, for some (including myself) they might be "too warm." They aren\'t very breathable, so I do need to remove them occasionally. That\'s typical for me, though, so I don\'t hold it against the design.The other issue is the memory foam: like most materials made to "remember", it tends to lose cushion quickly, and that will affect the comfort in 3-6 months. That\'s unfortunately a downside that no manufacturer seems to have solved.', "I got RockDove slippers for myself and liked them so much that I got pairs for my younger brother, younger sister-in-law and her boyfriend.My younger brother said they made his bare feet a bit sweaty when he was rushing around with them but still said immediately that they were super comfortable.My younger sister-in-law and her boyfriend have been living in them since Christmas and she said they are a real comfort to her feet after a busy day at work.Now if RockDove just made kids slippers we'd get her son a pair so the family could match. :)The tan-ish green and orange were for the boyfriend, green/green for the sister-in-law and black/orange for my younger brother.", "Don't ever wear slippers but was interested in trying some out during the winter. Got these memory foam ones and have been super happy. Where them all day while at home as great home shoes. The grip on the bottom makes going down my carpeted stairs feel safe. I wear a man's size 10 shoe always and ordered the 9-10. At first I feared I should have gone for the larger size, but they loosen up pretty quickly and now I find the fit to be perfect! Got my wife a pair of the men's that correspond to her smaller size and she loves them too. Can sit on the couch tucked up or in blankets without feeling like you are wearing shoes or something cumbersome. Made me an indoor slipper die hard, that is for sure. Won't be going without slippers any more. Highly recommend these affordable and good value memory foam slippers."]

['Great boat and quality', "These are great work boots or everyday. I do have a more flat left foot so they aren't great for walking miles at a time. I might get different insoles to help. But for everyday use around the property they do great. I'd buy them again for sure.", "I loooove these to the moon and back and am on my third pair. But sadly, the ones I bought in August of 2021 are breaking down at the toe line already. Considering I have probably worn these less than 60 times total ... it is very fast. Rubber will break at creases, but I've had other brand boots that lasted years, and some I still have from over a decade or more ago, so just be aware that these will not last you long. I recommend getting the size above what you need so you can wear thick socks."]

["I recently purchased the Brooks Men's Ghost Neutral Running Shoe and have been extremely satisfied with my purchase. The shoes are very comfortable and have a responsive feel when running. The cushioning is just right, providing enough support without feeling too soft or mushy. The fit is true to size and the quality of the materials and construction is excellent. I have worn the shoes for both short and long runs and they have held up well. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and would highly recommend the Brooks Men's Ghost Neutral Running Shoe to others.", 'I buy a lot of running shoes and have been loyal to Asics for years.  Was looking for a good cushioned shoe, not for running but for walking and to wear with jeans or shorts.  Saw these had great reviews.  Without question, this is the most comfortable athletic shoe I have ever purchased.  The cushioning is just right - not too little or too much.  This shoe also adds a little stability, which is important for my gait (I run in stability shoes).  I purchased and tested both the Brooks Ghost and the Asics Cumulus.  I kept the Ghost and returned the other - not even close.  Overall, this is a very comfortable walking shoe, casual shoe, and is good looking on top of that (I got the black and white).  If you are a neutral runner who does not need lots of stability, I\'m sure this shoe would be great for running too.  I may buy another pair before Brooks decides to "improve" upon it.  Glad I made this purchase.', 'I used to always purchase Nike shoes when I was younger due to it being what most people my age wore and I liked the style.Fast forward to the present these shoes are amazing andI will always look to this brand performance ans comfort.Im on my feet twelve hrs at work and i no longer feel pain and inserts are no longer needed. I also passed my fitness assessment in these shoes. Highly recommended.']

["I'll start with the negative portion of the review, and I only have one, but one that is important.  I had to drop down to a size 11 in this boot from a size 12, and the heel still is loose.  My dress shoes, cowboy boots, and running shoes, all size 12.  Not sure of others have had this issues, but just something to consider if you are buying this boot.Overall, I really like the boot, its easy to slide on, comfortable on your feet, and provides good arch support and cushion.  From climbing in and out greasy engine compartments, on and off the trailer, to standing on concrete and dirt all day...this is  very comfortable boot.  Just make sure you get the right size, and a thick heeled boot sock!  Would not hesitate to buy another pair.", 'Got these on discount for like $88. Have a pair of Ariat groundbreakers that I‚Äôve been wearing for 7 years, mostly when riding, and that I love. My old ones are start to get low on tread so decided to try these when I saw the sale price. I usually wear a 11.5 or 12 but in Ariat an 11EE is perfect. They do run and little large so I would get at least half size smaller. I was please that the color is actually a deeper brown than what is shown in the picture.', 'Boots are very comfortable. I bought these to replace a pair that had lasted longer than ANY OTHER WORK BOOT that I\'ve owned. Having said that, the older boots were 10+ years old and I couldn\'t find them again. So, each time I searched up the old product number, these showed up> so I gave em a try. First impression:  they may last through winter (but I\'ll update in spring). The materials appear to ALL be man-made / processed leather (which makes sense with the previous reviewer who showed sole delimiting). I ordered normal width but "EE\'s" showed up> maybe I no longer understand widths...?Suffice it to say, I like the way they feel, the insole wants to follow your footon the way out of the boot (poor quality / workmanship) and the "leather" materials appear to be 100% processed or man-made. The term "100% leather" seems a tad misleading and when I ordered a normal width but got EE\'s... that seems odd. These boots will probably end up too big once I wear them more. Time will tell. More to follow! A couple weeks in and they feel like slippers> that means in a year, they\'ll be like sloppy rubber boots. I hope I\'m wrong!']

['I am an avid hiker/backpacker. I have wide feet, so I used to love Vasque and Keen and Asolo, but I tried them on and they all seem to have changed. They used to fit me like a glove, not they seem to run narrow and I could not get them to be "Not Painful". I even went to REI and tried on several at the store. The Salesman said that they all have changed over the past few years. Finally, I ran across these boots and they fit perfect.', 'Moab2 seems a bit different. Toe box seems rounder. OK. I took a 9 in the old model, Amazon recommends a 7 for me. Went from this 9 to an 8-1/2EE. Nope. Then 8-1/2M. Yup. In the "real world" I should take a 7-1/2D, but that\'s with everyday socks. So ... with SmartWools, these in 8-1/2M work after a couple of days of breaking in, starting with athletic socks. Is this confusing? You bet. I\'ve given up on going purely with marked size. If you put on any kind of mileage you really do need to be fussy. It is what it is. Havent gotten the 8-1/2Ms wet yet, can\'t speak for waterproof quality. In my experience "waterproof" is more a wish than a specification. More on this later ;)', "I tried on the right shoe just to check the fit and the fit was good. Toe box was plenty wide for my wide feet. Instep was good for my high instep which is hard for me to find. The arch support is minimal and could be better. The heel felt very hard and could use more padding. Overall they felt ok but I might add an arch support insole. Star rating for the shoes if they arrived in good condition.The problem is the shoes were damp and moldy! White powdery mold all over them and they smell like a basement. The uppers are deformed from moisture. The box appears fine so I'm guessing they were repackaged from a batch that were damaged by water and sold at a discount. Completely unacceptable to sell products in this condition."]

['I have SUFFERED with feet pain for years! And one day I was talking to my sister and she told me about a orthopedic shoe that she bought and it did wonders for her feet and I thought to myself I need that shoe. So after I was done talking to her I went on Amazon and looked for the shoe and ordered it right away. And I have to say it was the best shoe I ever bought for myself I am pain free. So I just wanted to say you don‚Äôt have to suffer anymore with pain. Just get it for yourself I would recommend this product to everyone. Thank you oofos you gave me back my mobility.', 'When I first put these on, I thought "oh my," these are too weird. They felt spongy, with a higher than expect arch (I\'m flat-footed), and, to be honest, I felt unsteady in them. I\'m a longtime Crocs wearer who wanted to try an alternative. For those who wear Crocs you know they leave you feeling firmly planted on terra firma. Not these. I felt I was on a little cloud that was alternately setting me back on my heels, or feeling the need to lean forward in a self-conscious way. That said, I\'m coming to see that as a good thing. I also have neuropathy in my feet, which leaves me feeling unsteady when it\'s bad. These Ooofos keep me more alert to my step. They act as a kind of kinetic, therapeutic footwear that, for want of a better way of putting it, give my feet an ongoing workout. Whether it\'s a direct cause-effect or not, after a week of wearing them daily around my apartment, I feel steadier and more agile on my feet.', 'I work in food service - I‚Äôm on my feet 10-14 hrs a day.  These shoes are like walking on a spongy cloud.  I have high arches , wide feet and bunions , I can‚Äôt believe how great these shoes feel. Totally worth every penny.  Only downside no half sizes. I usually wear 8.5 but I got an 8 so I can only wear thin socks but very glad I bought these !!']

["1) ConstructionMy pair seemed to be well built, and light in hand.  I did not notice any rips, cracks or other separations in the components of the shoes. They are moderately flexible, more so if you remove whichever of two style inserts yours came with. (More on that, later)2) FitThe toe box on these is big and roomy, as a good shoe should be.I did notice a tight spot on these shoes, though this might have to do more with my individual physique than with the product:  A slightly tighter fit between the inside tops of my feet and the shoes, especially when wearing thicker than average thickness socks.  I was able to remedy this with a file bit for my drill, and gently filed away about 1mm of material from inside the top of the uppers of both shoes.I can now still wear them comfortably without socks, or, with socks of any thickness.3) On the Move:These are NOT Merrells or Danskos!  But they are an economical alternative with at least 70 percent of the arch and overall support I need at work, or for a mile-long walk around my neighborhood.  I have tested them with and without the included inserts, and have not experienced a whole lot of rubbing in most combinations.  For me, if I go barefoot, I will leave the bottom inserts in.  With my thicker socks, I can wear them with or without the inserts in.  Wearing my thickest Icelandic 30 belows, I can wear them without the inserts, on my leisure days when it is cold outside.I also own Crocs Lite Ride sandals, and can say that Crocs does know 'a thing or two' about orthotic support ergonomics.  And it has translated to the experience in these On The Clock clogs.4) Finally.. The SWEAT Factor!I've read a lot of reviews from wearers who state that their feet got really hot, and or sweaty and smelly in Crocs On The Clock.I would say that is true in my case - but only when wearing my thickest socks - the Icelandic 30 Below wools.  After a few hours in the Crocs/Icelandic combination, when I remove the Crocs, the bottoms of the Icelandics are indeed warm and wet! But not squishy wet.  And that leads me to my final section, regarding the title of this review...5) Two Flavors of On The Clock Clogs:I bought, from this page, the version with the dark spongy support inserts with fabric on top, and with small holes punched through the forward(toe box) section for breathability. That might explain my lack of the squishy-squeaky soaky experience I read in so many reviews here.There is another version, which looks externally exactly like mine, top to sole, but, it has the red or orange? insert that is just plain rubber, and has the same pattern as my aforementioned Crocs Lite Ride flip flops. Now in a shoe like these On The Clocks, even with the small holes they do come with, a solid rubber bottom, or insert if that's what that is, is what I would understand to be a recipe for really irritably hot, sweaty soles, with or without socks!  And that excessive sweat is what can lead to the squaking, pardon my french, 'farty' sounds of a thoroughly drenched foot against the rubber bottom of such a shoe.I would suspect that  most of the excessively 'hot n sweaty' and squeaky complaints are coming from wearers of that version, which I have yet to review.  I may be wrong.  Please let me know, if there is a reply function to these posted reviews.Overall, for under U.S. $50, they are a relatively light, comfortable, and supportive shoe for, as they are named, on the clock at work, or at home or out on the town.", "I work in several nursing facilities. We've had more COVID outbreaks and cases than I care to mention. I've basically given up wearing business attire and opted for scrubs since I could easily wash them as soon as I got home. I needed shoes that I could sanitize daily and that had non-slip properties. Closed tops were mandatory due to the possibility of spilled chemicals or body fluids.I used the bistro clogs for almost 2 years, but after a recent camping trip, the clogs shrunk a size, so my old clogs were basically for wearing around the house with no socks and for a short time (I can't see throwing them out just yet).  I used my other, personal crocs for a bit, but my infection prevention nurse reminded me that the holes in my other crocs were not sanitary or safe.Luckily, I got an Amazon gift card from my bother-in-law so I ordered these. They fit much better than the bistro clogs with much more width around the toe area. While I liked the convenience of just slipping on the clogs, the closed heel on these gave more support, especially on wet surfaces.I like the cushioned insert and, so far, I haven't had any excessive sweat issues. I have EEE wide feet and only the top of the shoe where it meets the top of my foot is snug. The sides where it meets the sides of my foot are just right. It's snug, too, but not uncomfortable. The toe area, like I said before, is roomy but not large.I bought these for a purpose and it meets my needs just fine. Like my bistro clogs, these will be only for work (I learned the hard way using them for pleasure what happens) and I'm sure I'll get at least a couple of years out of them. Hopefully, we can say goodbye to Covid soon and I won't have to wear these at work anymore. But for now, I'll keep them for the comfort, safety and ability to be disinfected and sanitized.", 'Great shoes but a solid tough shape with very little height inside, need very flat feet with low or no arches, I have to wear very thin socks to get my feet in and risk occasionally on very busy days developing large blisters on the very top of my foot as the bone and plastic are so close the skin is trapped and rubbing so blisters are a risk if your feet have arches, would recommend looking for something else or go a size bigger and find something super heavy and hope it can help squash it on the sides to give extra height inside, if you have no arches to the bones in your foot and everything is flat to the floor then these are perfect for you.']

I even bought a pair for my wife, and she said the same thing (she\'s someone who will happily pay $35 for sneakers and now calls the pair she recently purchased "trash" by comparison). ;)Lastly, it comes in a handful of unique color combinations, because of which I plan to pick up a couple more.I highly recommend them.']

["I work on roofs as a solar panel installer in Oregon so having good grip, durability, and water resistance is a must. This boot has been treating me very well! It has taken some hits but they're still holding together great. I wear size 9 usually and bought the normal width boot, but found they pinched the sides of my feet too much. So I bought these wider width ones and found that they no longer pinched, but my foot kind of shifted around in the boot a lot. I found that throwing an extra insole (Dr Scholl's) worked to keep my foot from moving around too much and they feel much better now.", "Great solid boot, feel damn near indestructible but the width just isn't there. I'm not sure if the width isn't actually wide-er, or if the forefoot of the boot is just shallow so you lose the width benefit in overall volume. Otherwise these boots are very well made. I've been pounding on them for + a year and believe it or not they still feel new. As long as your foot isn't a meaty 4E like mine, these boots will serve you well.**waterproofing is reliable and long lasting thus far", "First the negatives, the label inside the tongue is plastic instead of cloth like most decent boots.  The side material that attached the tongue to the boot would be perfect if it was slightly higher.  They're not very extra wide.  Now the positives, They are waterproof and are keeping my feet dry and warm enough with a basic pair of socks.  I expect them to be a one winter boot.  Good laces, and the nobs you put your laces through are properly positioned for a good snug fit.  The toes are tough enough that when I kicked ice off a vehicle by the wheel well, it didn't tear or scuff at -18¬∫.  I went through 4 pairs of other brands, including expensive ones to find these will work.  I've had better boots, but had to pay more.  I'm happy with what I paid for what I got, so much so that I bought 6 pair, so I'm good for this winter and the next 5 winters.  I'm tired of companies making something decent and then changing it the next year.  That's why I stocked up.  I double knot the laces and have them on all day and the ranch isn't destroying them right off like some boots.  They have a pretty good grip even on slick surfaces.  As long as my feet stay dry, they stay warm with basic jock socks.  I'm happy.Update 2/19- The stitching isn't holding up and I haven't used them rough.  It's unraveling opposite of the orange insignia where the black meets the leather.  Either the thread is cheap and or any glue/sealant used simply isn't holding and it's separating. One and 1/2 months and the boots are coming apart.  The rest of the boot is fine but snow melts and goes into the boot.  It's Literally right where the bottom lace eyelets are and your foot bends.  It's past where I can return them without getting spanked so I figure I have to raise Cain with Wolverine.  I have 6 pairs of these as I wanted to be set for a few years and didn't anticipate this happening.  This is a fatal flaw in the bootconstruction.  They should be glued at this part of the boot and a better thread used in case the stitching fails.Now I'm Bummed.  I ordered these on Dec 31, 2020 when the worst of winter was over.  This BITES.3rd Update: It's Oct 15,2021.  The patch I made with silicone held up where the thread came out.  These boots have taken a beating and my feet only got wet when snow or water came over the top.  They have worn like iron and we've just had 3 days of snow and mud.  It's all white and wet outside.  My feet are still dry and warm with just a pair of athletic socks.  I wore them in the summer when I had to be in wet pastures and my feet stayed dry.  The soles have help up tremendously well and so have the toes.  While they're heavier than some other boots out there, they have held up well.  I'm surprised they held up as well as they have.  The shank hasn't broken like they did in Danner boots and they have Keen boots beat by a mile.  Where the stitching came loose and I applied a small silicone patch, never got any worse.  One thing I did right at the start was use one entire can of silicone on  both boots as I do all my boots.  WHile not looking as good as some might like, they took a licking and I kept on kicking in them to get mud and such to release from the soles.  Best boots for durability I've had in a long time.  My feet did get some heat rash on them in the summer because they're sealed so well.  I can't believe I'm headed into another winter with them."]

["On my second pair. I do a LOT of outdoor running / hiking in the Rockies in all conditions and these are the only ones that hold up on the sides and toe. Love the quick lace and the tread is amazing at first (gets a bit dull later in life.) I run with these a lot in the snow too and they work and micro spikes go onto them easily as well the way their tread design is. Anyway, several thousand miles in these on all terrains and they are my go-to now. I'd take these for running on the road too and definitely before I'd lug heavy hiking boots unless you really needed the ankle support which I don't think most do.", 'Without a doubt or the least exaggeration, these are the best shoes I\'ve ever owned.Update:It\'s been months now and these are still the best shoes I have ever owned.Downside:The Insoles for mine were faulty. The left insole is fine. The right insole must have come "wrinkled" because it is absolutely painful to walk on. It is also very obviously wrinkled. This isn\'t a problem when they are dry. You\'d just notice some texturing. When wet, however, it is another matter.Salomon. Please sell the insoles! It is a real issue.Update II:I decided to do a serious test to see just what is up with these insoles.Here\'s the test:1. I walk 0.3 miles.2. The elevation change is a mild 128 feet. 39.0144 meters.3. I repeat this walk up and then down 5 times.4. The walk is a total of roughly 600 steps.5. The heat is 91 F in the shade ( 32 C) and 110 F (43.3 C) sustained exposure to the sunlight.6. It\'s anywhere between 55% humidity to 63% humidity without any further deviation for weeks now.Results:After 1.2 miles (1.931) kilometers the "wrinkle" gets wet from sweat and/or rain and the insole deforms at the arch of the foot nearest the ball and big toe.- this is consistent after 3 days of testing.The insole without the wrinkle produces no issues.Walking with the insoles is possible so long as the climate remains dry and the humidity very low. In other words, the issue wouldn\'t likely exist in a climate like Arizona, but would be a real problem in a tropical or temperate region where the humidity is consistently higher. I am, unfortunately, in such a climate.Walking without the insoles is also possible, but so far as I have found REPLACING THEM is not possible. If there is a way to do this Salomon has gone out of their way to mask it with a fanciful website full of pretty images that never gets to the point... "want insole, buy where?". Thank you.In all else, the shoes are very good. The arch support is simply the best. I\'ve tried most of the less expensive brands up to Keens. Keens make good sandals, but I wouldn\'t even call their other shoes footware compared to these.Another thing with the insole... you can walk without it, but don\'t try replacing it other insoles. It doesn\'t work. These shoes are designed to support your feet, not have your feet supported. It\'s a very big difference in functionality. If you want to experience a lot of unnecessary pain and anguish though, do try other insoles. I speak from experience. I\'ve about about 14 different kinds trying to replace these so far. The pain is exquisite, but none of them work like the ortholite. It\'s really irritating... perfect shoe... minor issue... but no solution. :/If it\'s any consolation I love the shoes so much I bought a second pair as I\'m sure I\'ll burn through these eventually and it takes quite awhile to actually get a pair once you order.', 'I had a four of the 4‚Äôs. The shoe itself holds up very well and if you toss it in the laundry every so often, it cleans up like new. I normally hit it with a waterproof spray right away as well. I have gotten 2 of the 5‚Äôs now as well. It has a bit of a higher ankle support but for lazy folks like me this is still a good ‚Äúslip on‚Äù. The lugs on the sole will slowly erode away and like any shoe the cushion goes south after a while. I still use all the old shoes however for yard work, etc‚Ä¶. The 4‚Äôs were a bit narrow but the 5‚Äôs more normal. I also have always liked the speed laces. As a shoe junkie these are probably a ‚Äú6‚Äù and one o& my favorites of all time.']

['I was super hesitant when I got them because they were more than I‚Äôve ever spent on shoes in my life. But, Docs have always had rave reviews so after months of them being in my cart I finally saved up to get them and bit the bullet. When I first tried them on I was a little unsure if I liked them. I was so used to snug fitting shoes and I thought they made my feet look ‚Äúbig‚Äù and they had a little more room than I‚Äôm used to. But boy, little did I know they would become my favorite go to shoes! They‚Äôre so easy to slip on, super comfortable, go with basically everything and durable. I‚Äôve worn them out on the town for a night out and my feet didn‚Äôt hurt at all walking around downtown all night. I also wore them riding ATV‚Äôs in backwoods Minnesota and hiking in Duluth, MN and they had such great traction and support. They only had a mild layer of dust and dirt that could easily be wiped off with leather cleaner (or a damp cloth) and they were good as new! I expect these to last for years to come seeing what I‚Äôve worn them through already. I‚Äôm a little late to the party but I have definitely jumped on the Dr. Martens bandwagon :)', "They're a little big but so comfy and incredibly durable! I've worn them around the Grand Canyon, the Grand Tetons, the Badlands, Custer, and a bunch of other state parks. My feet never hurt, and the traction and ankle support are wonderful. I have weak ankles from several injuries, and I trip a lot. These help keep my feet and ankles from rolling. Not to mention, they're easy to clean! I've also worn them to ride my horse in, at my job as a vet assistant, and with a skirt on special occasions. They're the best shoes I've ever had. No sign of wear or scuffing or anything. Plus, it's a nonbinary and lesbian fashion staple. These shoes are built to last. My only complaint is that rocks sometimes get stuck in the treads!", 'Perfect. Quality and fit as expected for Doc Martens.']

['I needed a mud/rain/slop/snow/slush boot to make my life easier. I researched more boots than I care to admit‚Ä¶these boots reviewed the best. Not the most expensive (nor least expensive) boot available. They priced somewhere near the upper mid-range. I pulled the trigger and I‚Äôm happy to report they are perfect.So, I‚Äôm a true size 10‚Ä¶.I ordered a size 10 and they fit perfectly. They slip right on, stay in place and slip right off my feet. I can wear them to run errands, mess around the yard and continue my walks outdoors. I‚Äôve been in a variety of miserable conditions and the Xtratuf boots worked perfectly.I live in a waterfront environment and these boots let me keep a maritime style and function. If you need a stylish and functional boot‚Ä¶get a pair.', 'I wear 10 1/2 wide shoes and size 11 fit perfect.  Took these on a Alaska fishing trip and they worked great.  They are so comfortable after being on a boat for ten hours and I am impressed with everything about them.. great boots!', 'My wife, both daughters and granddaughter have these boots and love them for comfort, keeping your feet dry and ease on and off.  I went to buy a pair at our local store and struggled finding them.  Apparently they are the yuppy thing to have and sell as soon as they hit the shelves.  Finally got me a pair here online through Amazon and yes, good boots.  I ended up paying about $15 more than the local price.  But after the one hour drive one way, savings in fuel will make this easier to take.  I docked the rating just because I have wide feet.  Usually wear a size 9, but had to go to a 10 in these models.  XtraTuf now has lots of variations of these boots.  I found some of the newer ones had softer soles and stiffer sides.  I wanted these with the tougher soles since I do wear these on rocks.  Lots of rain here in NW Oregon so looking forward to enjoying these boots and dry feet.  PS, my wife bought felt insoles for hers and took out the factory insole and a much better fit/comfort for her.  For me, I preferred mine with the original insole.']

["I wore these for the first time during water aerobics class.  It provided an excellent grip in the pool, was easily to put on and take off and looked great with my bathingsuit. ["I hope Nike never stops making these shoes. There are a couple of minor negatives. The soles are prone to pick up pebbles and the sole wears quickly. Even so, the 5-star rating is well deserved. ['I absolutely love these crocs. They will be perfect for my hotel / water park stay in a few weeks.  They arrived on time. ["At first I thought they were a little to big. They replace several different LB Evans models and a half doze or so open and closed off brand pair.  These seem well constructed and are pretty comfortable, warm but not overbearing. Still, over the years I have had man slippers and so far these are my favorites.  I think the price was fair.  If they hold up they may rise to 4.5 stars.
