['I think these are some nice boots for general use around the home. I use them for yard work and landscaping mostly. They are very comfortable and waterproof but the problem I do not like as much are the treads. When you are outside in moist or muddy areas, the treads get filled and the mud is difficult to come out so you track dirt and mud throughout a lot of areas.My previous boots treads were not as aggressive so the mud would not stay in the treads like these. Other than that there are nice boots to prevent your feet from getting wet and also keeping your feet warm!', "I walk in boots 10-15 miles per week during the winter and wet spring months. Have had 2 pairs of muck boots, the rubber is hard and brittle on those and they crack in several places after not that much walking and have not lasted (remained water proof) even 1 year. These things have a soft and more pliable rubber, have only put about 50 miles on them so far but all is good and I will be surprised if I don't get at least twice as long out of them as I did with the Mucks.", 'I‚Äôm a snowmaker at my local mtn and these are great for what I do. Very aggressive tread, heal tab, comfy for my wide feet, toasty. My socks stay dry too, my pants do get wet but that‚Äôs because of snow getting In between to boot and my overalls. Good on ice, I don‚Äôt go wild without my metal spikes but I‚Äôm able to get the job done when I forget them. I do about 20,000 steps a shift, I would recommend some bulky socks or different insoles for that mileage tho.']

["These are the best outdoor boots I have ever purchased. They are light, durable, warm, dry, comfortable, and affordable. Mine have been on many hikes and camping trips, as well as jaunts around urban areas in all types of weather. They are still holding up really well and have several more years of life in them. The high-traction soles are stealthy silent. I've been on my feet in these for days at a time and they are super comfortable. They are indeed waterproof unless you step in something deeper than the top of the boot, of course. I bought my original pair in 8.5 but purchased a second pair in a 9 to give more room for thicker socks when winter camping. The only downside to these is that my feet sweat in warmer weather and soak my socks.", 'My husband loves these. He says they fit comfortably and are good for doing a variety of things (walking, hiking, working in the garage, etc). The are very good quality and they can be used for a long while before they start to show signs of wear and tear. These are the third pair he‚Äôs had (different colors) and he will no doubt order them again when the ones he has eventually wear out!', 'I love Columbia products. I have a Columbia parka, that still looks new after 5 years. I purchased a similar pair of Columbia hiking boots 12 years ago. I wore them all winter. I finally needed a replacement. I saw these, because they looked similar. They are better. Very comfortable. We just had a  1/2 foot of snow and I was able to walk around without my feet getting cold or wet.']

['I was concerned about buying these without trying them first.  I purchase a Women‚Äôs size 8 and normally wear an 8-8 1/2.  These were a little roomy, but we‚Äôre fine with two pairs of socks.  I decided to put my orthotics in and only wore one pair of socks.  I hiked through woods and creeks for over 5 hours and was totally comfortable.  The sole had excellent grip through slippery mud.  They are a little challenging to remove, so I had my husband make me a boot jack.  I would purchase again,', "I've always spent the extra money and bought Muck boots. the last pair of Muck boots i bought were $200 and lasted MAYBE a month before cracking. I feel the quality of these boots are right up there with Muck but at a FRACTION of the price! Only issue I have with these boots are how tall they are. I have large calves and have to fold these boots down to put them on. Significantly taller than Muck boots but I'm okay with it!", 'The look and structure are sound but integrity not so much. Got a pair 45 days or so later they came undone at toe seam so got another ($120.00 in just under 2 months) and they did same thing in under 30 days. Decided to go with another option now at local fishing store. Hope it goes better. :(']

['I purchased these for my Husband who has the longest/largest mail route in the city consisting of a route he walks 6 days a week - 12 miles each day.The "postal" approved and provided uniform boots he gets each year are expensive and eat up more than half his allotted uniform allowance taking away from buying replacement pants/shirts that get worn out with torn pockets easily. So, he always has to decide which is needing the most replacing over the others. The P.O. boots last at most 6 months before the tread starts to fall off and/or holes appear. The Post Office provided shoes also require the dreaded breaking in, these do not. They run true to size, he wears a 10.5 and they fit great.My husband has said these fit great, are comfortable, waterproof, keep his feet warm (he\'s now only wearing 1 pair of socks) and no blister producing break in period!If in doubt on buying these, I can\'t think of a better endorsement than one coming from a walking 12 miles each day 6 days (sometimes 7) days a week man with Plantar Fibromas who also has over sublination of each foot saying these were a great purchase - then I don\'t know what is.We purchased these during a Christmas lightning deal for $45.00, next year he said buy two pairs (still cheaper than the P.O. provided boots). These are worth buying ourselves. A great boot at a great price.', "I need a wide toe box. Have serious bunions and a hammer toe on one foot. Normally I take a 12W. Winter boots are always a challenge. Happy to say the 13 has a really nice, wide toe box. No issues at all! After a month of snow and rain, still dry and warm. Snow does not get all clogged up on the soles. Have not had them on just sheer ice yet, so can't comment on that. They look ok. Not super high quality, not Walmart crap either. Seems to be a nice compromise of quality vs. price. But for me, the wide toe box, even with medium weight winter sox,  did the trick.", 'Fits to size (10.5). I previously bought another brand at a big box store that was $75 and they didn‚Äôt last a day. One of the lace loops broke off and they wouldn‚Äôt stay tied so I decided to order these and hoped they got here before the blizzard of 2022.They arrived faster than expected and I tried them on in the house to make sure they fit. Put them on to shovel snow while it was -18 outside and my feet never got cold. Good boots for the price. I hope I get at least 3 winters out of them.Great and fast shipping from Amazon even in the middle of a snow storm!Would be nice if they made steel toe so I could wear them to work but for around the yard these are perfect and the $45 price tag can‚Äôt be beat.4 stars. If Made In USA would give 5.']

['I bought a dozen pairs of boots over several years trying to find ones that fit well. For me these were the boots. This pair I don‚Äôt even know if it‚Äôll even come out of the box. ['Wanted to do a quick review as I just received these. Looking at all the comments people were saying to size up, so I did. ['I sometimes I hit golf balls with my training shoes on.  The shoes with 6-8 drop tend to bring your weight forward, which is very bad for a golf swing.  These shoes are 0 drop.  They are very comfortable and allow for correct balance when swinging a golf club.  They also give you a small, but functional stretch of the gastroc/soleus complex.  I am 64 with 2 total knee replacements.  I use the shoes for walking and elliptical.  Running is in my past.  But I recommend these shoes', "These shoes almost fit my feet (I got a size 9.5 wide, my feet are something like an 8.5 EEEE), which is nice, they are a bit tight over the top but not unwearable. They work with my orthotic insoles.The grip on the sole is awesome, works really well on rocks, dirt, trees, etcHowever, it suffers a lot in wet conditions. If you live in the desert these will keep you stable at a lot of angles very consistently, but I absolutely would not want to try to climb a tree in the rain in these and I'd be a bit careful on wet tile or metal even when flat, definitely watch out for rocks while on the trail.I've now had these shoes for a few months and the outsole is still in pretty good shape, with an average of 4-5 miles walked a day. I took em to the galapagos and I've taken them to wisconsin swamps and they worked decently well in both. On the other hand, parts of the inner materials are already fraying and falling apart. The quality of the various parts is very inconsistent.Speaking of wet conditions, these are not designed as water shoes but if you step into the sea with them they drain reasonably well and if you keep walking they dry out ok eventually, although it can take hours if you take them off and leave them to sit. In combination with fits wool socks I was pretty happy in terms of hiking in comfort even after getting my feet soaked.There is not a ton of cushion in these and I would like a version with more, but the altra versions with more do not come in the same size options.", 'Would get 5 stars except I am not sure about durability.  I will upgrade if they stand the test of time.  I love the ergonomic toe box.  This makes all the difference.  One word of advice.  If you buy these be careful to get one that is long enough.  I bought a pair in size 11 and my toes just brushes front enough to become a little uncomfortable after a while.  That was because they felt great until I walked a couple of miles.  The newer pair is a half size larger and are much better.  Even so, the size 11 is more comfy than most other shoes.  I don‚Äôt like the laces but that is a minor point.  They are very thin and hard to grip and pull up tight.  That is easy to fix however and I won‚Äôt downgrade them for that.']

['                    Die Medien konnten nicht geladen werden.', '                ', "\xa0This is the closest I most likely will ever get to owning a Cartier Tank watch so hats off to Seiko! The band complements the black hour markers perfectly however I'll being purchasing a brown leather band soon(23mm).  I researched the hell out of this timepiece and had to bounce around to alot of different websites to get any solid numbers.  When it arrived today I  took my measurements  and now I don't want to remove it from my 6 1/2  inch wrist. ['I bought these for $20 bucks to get me by at farm and fleet on clearance. Almost 2 years later bought 2 more pairs. Yes these pics are 2 years of use. Mechanic shop use and I also plow. So concrete all day oils and fluids and 2 seasons of snow and salt ( I wear them in the winter also). Are they the most high end, no. For the price do they do what they say yes. Did they do better than $100 shoes I have bought, yes! I see many saying they slipped and fell with these. As a plow driver who deals with ice will tell you it‚Äôs slips resistant not slip proof. Your balance is just lacking. They give great traction when needed. they have great grip for what they are. Don‚Äôt pretend you can‚Äôt fall in any pair of shoes unless your wearing cleats with metal spikes. Super comfortable (once broken in) and stayed that way till I threw them in the trash almost 2 years later. The insoles are good to great that come in them without a extra $30 insoles. Not water proof but kept my feet pretty dry during a 6‚Äù snow fall on a 23 hr shift I also shoveled that night. To sum it up. For the price was more than happy to buy again. Good traction, comfortability, support, and water proofing even when the soles could eat my flashlight!', 'These are nice grippy shoes that have good support. The only issue with them are the short laces and the laces are flat. ['I‚Äôve been buying NB for years and wanted this model for trail use.  The local store didn‚Äôt carry them but I figured I‚Äôve rarely tried them on because they consistently fit. I find NB shoes last a long time and they‚Äôve never come apart, even wearing them in all weather (including snow and rain).Over all I like these shoes.The tread design works well ‚Äúoff road‚Äù.  I use them to walk the dogs or jog in the woods on the local dirt trails. I find them comfortable and fit as expected and the traction is good.  Also, mud doesn‚Äôt cake in them, I‚Äôm able to easily stamp the dirt off.Two downsides:  1) the laces are thin (yet strong) strings which easily slide through the eyelets which I find difficult to snug the shoe. I pull and when cinching the knot they let go just a bit. Plus they come undone often.  It has been difficult to tighten the bottom and work up because they slide through the holes quickly. My running shoes have thicker laces and stay tight.  Yes, Laces are simple to replace.2) the arch support could be better. They do have support, but I could use a bit more.  Other shoes I‚Äôve had came with little shims, it would be nice if NB could do something like that.', 'I have purchased 3-4 pairs of this running shoe. I run 6x per week x 3 miles = 18 miles per week. I need to replace my shoes every 6 months; otherwise, the shoe lose the support (normal for runner)1) Shoe is semi-water proof. The sole of the shoe does not get wet2) Shoe is semi-warm for running in the winter3) Medium support. Not great, but just enough.4) I wear old runner shoe for casualI work from home and wear a separate indoor running shoe for support. I cannot wear Slippers or walking around the house in bare feet  for long periods of time.My only negative is that I cannot buy a 11-3E shoe size. 4E is a little wide, but I make it work.', "I have end-stage liver disease, and for several years I've been battling edema. Even the largest socks wouldn't fit me. Finally, I got a Hepatologist who cares enough to really work with me, and since August of 2022, I've had no Edema.  Still a little hesitant, I went with a pair of New Balance. I've worn these in the past for many years, and always trusted then to be durable, good-looking and always a great fit.  I ordered these in my old size (10.5W) instead of the size 12 Amazon recommended. They fit perfectly, look great, and have a nice grippy (that's a technical term, btw) sole. As to durability, we'll have to see...but I don't expect to be disappointed."]

['Lifelong runner, retired Marine with several marathons and half-marathons under my belt; 6\'2" & 210 pounds.  I have been wearing Asics for 20+ years, mostly the GT-2000 series and its predecessor.  I have noticed over the last couple of years that the GT-2000 series have not quite felt the same in quality and comfort.  I had recently checked out a professional reading blog comparing the GT-1000 and the GT-2000 series.  It actually made note that the GT-1000s actually felt a bit more like the older GT-2000s. So, I gave them a try.  They felt okay.  But I had also started looking at the Kayano\'s.  Amazon had a pair that was almost half off the original price in a decent color scheme, so I decided to give them a try.  Out of the box they were one of the most comfortable pairs of running shoes I have ever owned. Having used them for 3 runs so far, they have been amazing with great support and cushioning.', 'I have been running in Kayanos for over 20 years (1998). I also have an MS in Exercise Physiology and have taken enough anatomical kinesiology and biomechanics classes to say, with a certain degree of certainty, that every 3-4 years gremlins seem to take over the design of the Kayanos and manage to screw up a good shoe. However, the stars have aligned and all is right in the world again.....the 28s emulate many of their successful predecessors. Enough of my sarcastic wit. Seriously, I would like to know if any of the shoe engineers at Asics are runners themselves or if they utilize focus groups before they unveil some of the more recent disasters. Regardless, the 28s are a keeper!', "I've had a pair of Kayano 20's for a few years now which have held up great and provided solid cushioning for close to 1,000 miles of mostly sub-5 mile runs. I now have about 400 mi on the Kayano 28's and there is clearly significantly faster wear taking place on the traction sole of the shoe vs the 20s. Perhaps traction is better with the 28's and that is the tradeoff, though I never noticed an issue with traction with the 20's. Perhaps the 28's are more cheaply made, but if so, the savings have certainly not been passed onto the consumer, as the 28's were more expensive than the 20's. Overall I like the shoes, they are very comfortable and supportive. The fit is great (went with wide this time as the 20s put a bit too much pressure on my small toes at the same size, 12 1/2). I just have a strong feeling I'm going to be worn through the soles in half the time as I was with the 20's."]

['My husband likes them alot', 'Support', "For the money you are spending on these shoes you are getting poor quality. UPDATE Contact Keen and told me they are not cheaply made. I beg to differ just look at the reviews I told her. Keen did nothing as most customers service really don't care about customer service. I will try and get a replacement and see if they last two days for me. I had boots that cost me half as much and last 6 to 12 months. But one day. WOW"]

["I have been working in construction for 22 years and I have worn a lot of boots, from the cheapest to very expensive.  These are by far the best most comfortable boots I have ever had that are actually tough enough for work.  Now I have had boots that may have been as comfortable or maybe slightly more, but they just don't last at all.  These are freaking tough and feel great.  I can wear them all day at work and I am in no hurry to take them off when I get home like so many others.  When I am starting a new project I spend a lot of time kneeling on concrete laying out walls and other things, which destroys the toe of even the toughest boots, but the toe protection that is on this boot is pretty much bulletproof.  The thread on it that looks like a truck tire,  has been worn a little smooth in spots on mine from more than a year of use now, but it is still in great shape.  I love the and when the time does come for a new pair of boots, I will DEFINITELY be buying another pair of these.", "I work in the food industry so was after a slip resistant and waterproof boot. Ideally would have wanted something chemical resistant as well, unfortunately these aren't listed as such. Although, it claims to be oil resistant.These are a joy to put on. The anti-fatigue sole really works. Feels like you are walking on pillows. Being summer in Australia at the moment, my feet do get a little warm if I am walking to and from site and on the street. But once at work. The insulation never feels too warm.Solid construction and feels like they will last awhile. Haven't spilt anything on them yet. So can't comment on how waterproof they are.", 'I work on industrial airline equipment. I‚Äôve had a pair of these boots for almost 2 years now. I owned a pair of carhartt boots prior to these and they only lasted me 6 months or so.  I‚Äôve stepped on burnt metals with these boots after using a torch, I‚Äôve had these boots covered in aircraft de-icing fluid, diesel, gas, oil, brake cleaner, and many other damaging chemicals. The boots are very warm in below zero temperatures. They are also the best waterproof boots I‚Äôve ever owned. I‚Äôve put these boots through hell and they have no major signs of wear other then the burn marks on the bottom side of the soles. These boots have good traction in snow and rain. The heel protection & composite toe on the boots are a life saver. The only honest down falls of these boots are the laces are trash, the sole inserts are trash so you‚Äôll have buy better ones or replace them around 6 months depending how much you use the boots and how much you are on your feet.']

['Shoe sizes are tough since so many brands vary in what they say any size is. But, I\'ve worn enough Skechers to know how they fit. Even still, I bought try before you buy just in case. At any rate, these arrived and I tried them on. Very tight. Not too tight. And I knew they would give a bit. After wearing for a week, I can say they fit great and you would never know they are slip on shoes because they never slide up and down. I\'ve found them to be great for walking since the soles are nicely cushioned and thick! I prefer these to Skechers "walking" shoes even.', 'I could only rate what I was able to determine by "examination".  I normally wear a size 11E shoe, so I ordered the wide version.  It was wide all right - I probably had an extra quarter inch of space beside my foot and almost that much in front of my toes when I put the shoe on.  So I couldn\'t really rate them beyond what I could tell with a shoe that was far too big for me. Actually not only did I order the wrong size, I accidentally ordered the wrong shoe (I hate slip-ons - I want laces, or clasps, or rivets, or screws, or bolts, or ... well that\'s an exaggeration but you get the message... I want something that I can lace as tightly or loosely as I want.  But that\'s just me.)  I ordered a different Skecher which is very similar to this one except that it has laces and I like that pair a lot.However, I did have a talk with a neighbor who also wears a very similar Skecher shoe.  He has 3 pair of them, all for working on hard floors, and they are all the same size THEORETICALLY.  There seems to be a good deal of variation in size even in shoes of the same exact model and size.  So you need to be sure to try them on and return them for a better fit if that should happen to you.  They\'re good once you get a pair that fits well, and that\'s probably the most important factor to take away from my comment.I  would recommend these if you like slip-on\'s ... (I\'m just set in my ways and have had too many "slip-ons" slip OFF at unexpected times in the past, so I don\'t like them).', "I have the worst time finding shoes that fit, and most shoe stores don't have shoes the fit well, feel comfortable, and have a reasonable price tag, so I was very pleased to find these. I love the fit, they are very comfortable, and I didn't have to spend a fortune to get exactly what I needed. The fit and quality are great, and I like the fact that it was so easy to order them, I didn't have to go to multiple stores or choose from a limited supply. Definitely going to be my go-to for buying shoes in the future."]
